commit_message:
Implement nfs manage/unmanage of a volume

This bp is aim to implement nfs manage/unmanage of a volume.

Change-Id: I71733fa655ace8c2ef0dd919639b0e6733b0ef99
Implements: blueprint nfs-manage-unmanage-volume
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/09/340209/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mathfrom six import movesfrom cinder.volume import utils as volutils def manage_existing(self, volume, existing_ref): """Manages an existing volume. Renames the volume to match the expected name for the volume. Error checking done by manage_existing_get_size is not repeated. """ vol_name = existing_ref['source-name'] self._get_volume(vol_name) if volutils.check_already_managed_volume(vol_name): raise exception.ManageExistingAlreadyManaged(volume_ref=vol_name) # Attempt to rename the volume to match the OpenStack internal name. try: self._rename_volume(vol_name, volume['name']) except putils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: exception_message = (_("Failed to rename volume %(name)s, " "error message was: %(err_msg)s") % {'name': vol_name, 'err_msg': exc.stderr}) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException( data=exception_message) def manage_existing_get_size(self, existing_object, existing_ref): """Return size of an existing volume for manage existing volume. existing_ref is a dictionary of the form: {'source-name': <name of volume>} """ # Check that the reference is valid if 'source-name' not in existing_ref: reason = _('Reference must contain source-name element.') raise exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference( existing_ref=existing_ref, reason=reason) vol_name = existing_ref['source-name'] vol = self._get_volume(vol_name) # Raise an exception if we didn't find a suitable volume. if not vol: kwargs = {'existing_ref': vol_name, 'reason': 'Specified logical volume does not exist.'} raise exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference(**kwargs) try: vol_size = int(math.ceil(float(vol['size']) / units.Gi)) except ValueError: exception_message = (_("Failed to manage existing" "%(name)s, because reported size %(size)s " "was not a floating-point number.") % {'name': vol_name, 'size': vol['size']}) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException( data=exception_message) return vol_size def _get_volumes(self): """Get all nfs volumes. :returns: List of Dictionaries with volume info """ run_as_root = self._execute_as_root vol_list = [] self._ensure_shares_mounted() if not self._mounted_shares: raise exception.NfsNoSharesMounted() mount_point = self._get_mount_point_for_share(self._mounted_shares[0]) du, _ = self._execute('du',r"-ab", mount_point, run_as_root=run_as_root) if du is not None: volumes = du.split() iterator = six.moves.zip(*[iter(volumes)] * 2) for size, name in iterator: vol_list.append({"name": name.replace(mount_point+'/', ''), "size": size}) return vol_list def _get_volume(self, name): """Get reference object of volume specified by name. :returns: dict representation of Logical Volume if exists """ ref_list = self._get_volumes() for r in ref_list: if r["name"] == name: return r return None def _rename_volume(self, vol_name, new_name): """Change the name of an existing volume.""" self._ensure_shares_mounted() if not self._mounted_shares: raise exception.NfsNoSharesMounted() mount_point = self._get_mount_point_for_share(self._mounted_shares[0]) src_volume = mount_point + r"/" + vol_name dest_volume = src_volume.replace(vol_name, new_name) try: self._execute('mv', src_volume, dest_volume, run_as_root=True) except putils.ProcessExecutionError as err: LOG.exception(_LE('Error renaming volume')) LOG.error(_LE('Cmd :%s'), err.cmd) LOG.error(_LE('StdOut :%s'), err.stdout) LOG.error(_LE('StdErr :%s'), err.stderr) raise def unmanage(self, volume): pass

commit_message:
DONT MERGE : FOR TESTING ONLY - Test ovs python from sources

Recently cond_monitor and update2 support was added to
ovs python. ovsdb_monitor code in the OVN ML2 driver is broken
as there is a bug. Testing it on the CI to be sure.

The fix to the issue is submitted on the upstream ovs patch
https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/651140/

Change-Id: I0fd9f39dc4ccb4b079b05dfe1604853720a1dfbb

commit_message:
pep8, unittest: unbreak gate failure

With the update of CI, new failures are unveiled as follows.
This patch unbreaks it.
- pep8: fix N531, N534 which is newly introduced
- gate-networking-odl-pythonXX: test_update_router

Closes-Bug: #1607975
Change-Id: I849af701aa044cd362dbec52aeefd59f6dd0c383

commit_message:
Functional Test: Sync ACLs

Enhance functional tests to ensure that ACLs are properly
synchronized during OVN NB DB synchronization.

While enhancing the tests, a bug was discovered that resulted
in synchronization removing all ACLs for a port when it only
needed to create the port in OVN (ACLs already exist). This
was caused by duplicate ACLs being created during the port sync.

Change-Id: Ief64f73511de70ff16aaf2a2a9d26ae5a718c3b3
Closes-Bug: #1594241

commit_message:
Don't update ACLs on security group update

Neutron only supports updating a security group name and description.
Such updates don't impact ACLs so there's no need to register a
callback to do the ACL update.

Change-Id: Icfb9a2ffcad105e6d659b5c1cd81d92c4a0eae3c
Related-Bug: #1560817

commit_message:
Modified into a more appropriate function

  If the function includes none parameters, AssertIsNone() is more
appropriate than assertEqual()

Change-Id: I4155133694ca024c717209a9cb7cd6fd11d50f83

commit_message:
bump requirement for saharaclient (newton)

this client contains several important changes that
can be consumed at least by users like sahara-dashboard and others:

1. plugin's updates support
2. fix about using version as argument in CLI
3. pagination implementation

Change-Id: If701b43fc2eddec0f8df09c139d7754809d00c52
Signed-off-by: Vitaly Gridnev <vgridnev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add a tempest test for patching notification with new type and period

Patching notification type from WEBHOOK to EMAIL and at the same time
change period from 60 to 0 should pass the test. Because when type change
to email, period is specified to zero too.

Change-Id: Iaf5e141f67ebf63fdb9da1754ee264b4baacb23d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/42/342442/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_patch_notification_method_type_and_period(self): type = 'WEBHOOK' notification = helpers.create_notification(type=type, period=60) resp, response_body = self.monasca_client.create_notifications( notification) self.assertEqual(201, resp.status) self.assertEqual(type, response_body['type']) id = response_body['id'] new_type = 'EMAIL' new_period = 0 resp, response_body = \ self.monasca_client.\ patch_notification_method(id, type=new_type, period=new_period) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(new_type, response_body['type']) resp, response_body = self.monasca_client.\ delete_notification_method(id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) @test.attr(type="gate")

commit_message:
Remove -H from sudo command in plugin.sh

-H is to set HOME variable to target user's home dir
This is not necessary in this case

Change-Id: I088e8f14077073bfbfa296092846f2c4a11fef48

commit_message:
Use api_extensions to decide security_group type nova used

Even the system enables neutron, if neutron's security_group
extension is disabled, Nova can still use nova's security_group
by setting security_group_api=nova in nova.conf. So this is to
use neutron's security group only when neutron is enabled and
neutron's security_group extension is enabled.

Change-Id: I713b2fb04400c1b892aec9b09e0ff744db8d8d4e
Closes-Bug: #1583851

commit_message:
zuul/tripleo: optimize multinode and undercloud layout

Only run TripleO multinode & undercloud jobs for Newton and beyond.
No need to waste resource on stable/mitaka and before, jobs will fail.

subject: Don't use exponential back-off for report_state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 09:12:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4924675cebbd42b3864accf9adfed15fcf57b30d', 'message': "Don't use exponential back-off for report_state

Closes-Bug: #1606827
Change-Id: I15aeea9f8265b859bb1a8ee933b8b2ce1e64b695
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 11:59:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bb989be99db84a2789abe2849c786a075e3f5ab7', 'message': "Don't use exponential back-off for report_state

If an agent tries to report_state to the neutron-server and it fails
because of a timeout (raising oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout), then
there is an exponential back-off effect, which causes the
seemingly-simple report_state RPC call to take 60 seconds, then 120,
then 240 and so on. This can happen if all the controllers are
restarted simultaneously a number of time, as the bug report describes.

Since the feature was intended for heavy RPC calls (like get_routers())
and not for light calls such as report_state, it's safe to reduce the
timeout to a constant 60 seconds interval.

Closes-Bug: #1606827
Change-Id: I15aeea9f8265b859bb1a8ee933b8b2ce1e64b695
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use exponential back-off for report_state

If an agent tries to report_state to the neutron-server and it fails
because of a timeout (raising oslo_messaging.MessagingTimeout), then
there is an exponential back-off effect, which causes the
seemingly-simple report_state RPC call to take 60 seconds, then 120,
then 240 and so on. This can happen if all the controllers are
restarted simultaneously a number of time, as the bug report describes.

Since the feature was intended for heavy RPC calls (like get_routers())
and not for light calls such as report_state, it's safe to reduce the
timeout to a constant 60 seconds interval.

Closes-Bug: #1606827
Change-Id: I15aeea9f8265b859bb1a8ee933b8b2ce1e64b695

subject: Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 02:39:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d2572709cac57d9eb1a0f5a2f39c0bf17901cea', 'message': "Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races

As the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/265685/ mentioned
that race may happen after a delete RPC between l3 agents.
The metadata-proxy process will be spawned and alive
after all info of a HA router was deleted in the l3 agent.
And the metadata-proxy monitor will be created in the l3
agent which means that 'kill' it is not a proper way to clean
the stale process.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race in l3 agent side.
To ensure that the router info was removed from the l3 agent
router_info as early and soon as possible.
And then, when a HA router need to spawn metadata-proxy,
make the spwan condition just more specific.

Change-Id: I9b1eadc24b9dc6285ca47156f9ee0c9303c22dac
Closes-Bug: #1523780

"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-02 07:27:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a96a9c2362710a46869d90cc0e90095af0e1b572', 'message': "Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races

There has race condition between l3 agents after a HA router
delete RPC. Such as the metadata-proxy process, it will be
spawned and stay alive after all attributes of a HA router
was deleted in the l3 agent.
And the process monitor for metadata-proxy will be created
in the l3 agent which means that 'kill' it is not a proper
way to clean the stale process, l3 agent will got namespace
related exception while try to respawn the process.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race in l3 agent side.
When a HA router need to spawn child processes, the added
condition which is try to retrive the router from the neutron
server to inspect the router existence.

Change-Id: I9b1eadc24b9dc6285ca47156f9ee0c9303c22dac
Closes-Bug: #1533455
Related-Bug: #1523780
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2016-03-04 10:35:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1ab0e976726def035249ba848a3193d62dd0c6e7', 'message': "Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races

There has race condition between l3 agents after a HA router
delete RPC. Such as the metadata-proxy process, it will be
spawned and stay alive after HA router and all its resources
or attributes was deleted in the l3 agent.

And the process monitor for metadata-proxy will be created
in the l3 agent which means that 'kill it' is not a proper
way to clean the stale process, l3 agent will get namespace
related exception when try to respawn the process.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race in l3 agent side.
When a HA router need to spawn child processes, the added
condition which is try to retrive the router from the neutron
server to inspect the router existence.

Change-Id: I9b1eadc24b9dc6285ca47156f9ee0c9303c22dac
Closes-Bug: #1533455
Related-Bug: #1523780
"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2016-03-07 08:27:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b44609625461c58b077b134bcbe7e85c19ac3ad7', 'message': 'Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races

There has race condition between l3 agents after a HA router
delete RPC:
Once a fanout HA router delete notification comes to the
shedulered l3 agents, the master router in one agent will
delete all HA attributes and processes, such as keepalived
VRRP, but because the backup router in another agent has
not ever got/run the HA router delete procedure, or any
thing that delay the backup to remove its keepalived VRRP
process, then due to the VRRP procotol, the backup will
set its router state to master. Then it will run a series
of operations, such as respawn the external processes,
notify neutron server that here has a HA router state change.

For the spawned processes, it will stay alive after HA router
and all its resources/attributes and processes were deleted
when the backup(agent) concurrently run the delete procedure.

This patch add a HA router existence check which is try to
retrive the router info from the neutron server. So when l3
agent try to process the HA router state change operations,
it must ensure that the router is still existed in neutron
server.

Change-Id: I9b1eadc24b9dc6285ca47156f9ee0c9303c22dac
Closes-Bug: #1533455
Related-Bug: #1523780
'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2016-03-12 03:30:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b7a00b493866290ffb35a9b56dadfb720a1a2798', 'message': 'Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races

There has race condition between l3 agents after a HA router
delete RPC:
Once a fanout HA router delete notification comes to the
shedulered l3 agents, the master router in one agent will
delete all HA attributes and processes, such as keepalived
VRRP, but because the backup router in another agent has
not ever got/run the HA router delete procedure, or any
thing that delay the backup to remove its keepalived VRRP
process, then due to the VRRP procotol, the backup will
set its router state to master. Then it will run a series
of operations, such as respawn the external processes,
notify neutron server that here has a HA router state change.

For the spawned processes, it will stay alive after HA router
and all its resources/attributes and processes were deleted
when the backup(agent) concurrently run the delete procedure.

This patch add a HA router existence check which is try to
retrive the router info from the neutron server. So when l3
agent try to process the HA router state change operations,
it must ensure that the router is still existed in neutron
server.

Change-Id: I9b1eadc24b9dc6285ca47156f9ee0c9303c22dac
Closes-Bug: #1533455
Related-Bug: #1523780
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure no stale process lives in l3 agent side after races

There has race condition between l3 agents after a HA router
delete RPC:
Once a fanout HA router delete notification comes to the
shedulered l3 agents, the master router in one agent will
delete all HA attributes and processes, such as keepalived
VRRP, but because the backup router in another agent has
not ever got/run the HA router delete procedure, or any
thing that delay the backup to remove its keepalived VRRP
process, then due to the VRRP procotol, the backup will
set its router state to master. Then it will run a series
of operations, such as respawn the external processes,
notify neutron server that here has a HA router state change.

For the spawned processes, it will stay alive after HA router
and all its resources/attributes and processes were deleted
when the backup(agent) concurrently run the delete procedure.

This patch add a HA router existence check which is try to
retrive the router info from the neutron server. So when l3
agent try to process the HA router state change operations,
it must ensure that the router is still existed in neutron
server.

Change-Id: I9b1eadc24b9dc6285ca47156f9ee0c9303c22dac
Closes-Bug: #1533455
Related-Bug: #1523780
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/266109/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron._i18n import _, _LI, _LW from neutron.agent.linux import ip_lib def _ensure_master_router_can_spawn_metadata_proxy(self, ri): # To save the RPC call here check the HA router attributes first. if not (ri.keepalived_manager and ri.ha_port): # HA router has been executed 'DELETE' procedure concurrently. LOG.warning(_LW("Will not spawn metadata proxy for HA router %s, " "since it was under a concurrent " "deleting procedure."), ri.router_id) return False else: try: interface_name = ri.get_ha_device_name() if not (ri.keepalived_manager.get_process().active and ip_lib.device_exists(interface_name, namespace=ri.ha_namespace)): # HA router has been executed # 'DELETE' procedure concurrently. LOG.warning(_LW("Will not spawn metadata proxy " "for HA router %s, " "HA router has no active " "keepalived process, or its " "HA device was deleted concurrently."), ri.router_id) return False except (TypeError, AttributeError): # If any of the HA attribute is not set # or deleted concurrently return False LOG.warning(_LW("Will not spawn metadata proxy " "for HA router %s, " "since the router HA attributes are not " "properly set, or it's HA attributes was " "deleted concurrently"), ri.router_id) return False # If HA router all attributes are OK try to get the HA router info # from the neutron server in order to provent the race # between L3 agents after a DELETE RPC try: # Do not trust the L3 agent side router info routers = self.plugin_rpc.get_routers(self.context, [ri.router_id]) except Exception as e: LOG.warning(_LW("Will not spawn metadata proxy " "for HA router %(router_id)s, " "unable to fetch router information %(error)s"), {"router_id": ri.router_id, "error": e}) return False if routers: if routers[0].get('id') == ri.router_id: # Finally successfully get the router info # then spawn metadata proxy return True LOG.warning(_LW("Will not spawn metadata proxy for HA router %s, " "unable to ensure that " "the HA router is still existed"), ri.router_id) return False def _update_metadata_proxy(self, ri, router_id, state): if (state == 'master' and self._ensure_master_router_can_spawn_metadata_proxy(ri)): # Ensure that all the HA router resources/attributes are correct
deleted_lines: from neutron._i18n import _, _LI def _update_metadata_proxy(self, ri, router_id, state): if state == 'master':

commit_message:
devstack: Disable Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC

Recently the default has been changed. [1]
This commit make it back because the new default is not
compatible with us.

[1] Id20e67aba5dfd2044b82c700f41c6e648b529430

Closes-Bug: #1605481
Change-Id: Id408676e1e6105d0e8344e117bc0f8835cb609cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/22/345822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We don't support "flat" network type. Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC=${Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC:-False}

commit_message:
Fix arguments to _auth_required()

_auth_required() already prepends the string
"An auth plugin is required to" to the message callers
pass-in.  Change get_auth_connection_params() to pass
a correct, shortened string.

Change-Id: Iab9c6d7fa92e0d5400dece2f9a18a7a5d3cad497
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/23/348523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth = self._auth_required(auth, 'fetch connection params')
deleted_lines: msg = 'An auth plugin is required to fetch connection params' auth = self._auth_required(auth, msg)

Add internal_info field to port

This change adds the possibility to output the port's internal_info
field in port-show command.

[install] add a "node" and update the case of "dashboard"

- adds the word "node" to improve the clarity of the sentence
- fixes the capitalization of horizon service name

Remove listen option

The deprecated config option ``listen```of the group ``serial_console``
has been removed, as it was never used in the code.

commit_message:
Remove volume_api_class option

The deprecated ``volume_api_class`` config option has been
removed. We only have one sensible backend for it, so
don't need it anymore.

Change-Id: Ie9d3f9251613f002dce7dd661897707369f70108

commit_message:
Add missing ComputeHostNotFound exception in live-migration

Commit c824982e6a3d6660697e503f7236377cc8202d41 did not update
expected exceptions. Therefore we end up with 500 internal server
error when triggering targeted live migration to non-existing compute
node. This patch adds ComputeHostNotFound to expected exception list
in both, conductor and API.

Change-Id: If515a90217a8e329d932dcacb357b78081c505c1
Related-bug: 1538837

added_lines: exception.ComputeHostNotFound,

commit_message:
Added test cases for DVR L3 schedulers.

Test cases listed below are to run for Chance and Least-routers scheduler,
for both auto and explicit scheduling.
  1. Legacy router scheduled on dvr_snat agent.
  2. Distributed router not scheduled on legacy agent.
  3. Distributed router not scheduled on dvr agent.
  4. Distributed router scheduled on dvr_snat agent.
  5. Already hosted legacy router not scheduled on dvr agent.
  6. Already hosted legacy router not scheduled on dvr_snat agent.
  7. Already hosted distributed router not scheduled on legacy agent.
  8. Already hosted distributed router not scheduled on dvr agent.
  9. Already hosted distributed router not scheduled on dvr_snat agent.
  10. Already hosted legacy router not scheduled on additional dvr agent.
  11. Distributed router not scheduled if it is on a different external
      network than the dvr_snat agent.

Change-Id: I94d6654631b3cd66dfd469b1230c3ec20d0c0369
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/57/188157/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import l3_dvrscheduler_dbclass TestL3NatAgentDVRSchedulingServicePlugin(TestL3NatBasePlugin, l3_dvr_db.L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, l3_dvrscheduler_db. L3_DVRsch_db_mixin): supported_extension_aliases = ["router", "l3_agent_scheduler"] def __init__(self): super(TestL3NatAgentDVRSchedulingServicePlugin, self).__init__() self.router_scheduler = importutils.import_object( cfg.CONF.router_scheduler_driver) self.agent_notifiers.update( {l3_constants.AGENT_TYPE_L3: l3_rpc_agent_api.L3AgentNotifyAPI()})

subject: Be more explicit about Class E
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 17:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/vmt-process.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ossa/commit/ddfbe1e123b687196286ac1d254c3cc6d66c2de0', 'message': 'Be more explicit about Class E

In our taxonomy, Class E is not meant to apply to hardening
opportunities (which are also technically not vulnerabilities). Be
clearer that they are excluded by E.

commit_message:
Be more explicit about Class E

In our taxonomy, Class E is not meant to apply to hardening
opportunities (which are also technically not vulnerabilities). Be
clearer that they are excluded by E.

Change-Id: I4830b954104da03bc83e7c3533544a564b4837ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/79/348979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | Class E | | Neither a vulnerability nor hardening | | | | opportunity |
deleted_lines: | Class E | | Not a vulnerability at all |

commit_message:
Sheepdog:fix the bug of failed to clone image

The current sheepdog driver has two bugs when deciding whether
an image is cloneable:

1.It uses the addr in image_location url to find the image volume,
if the image volume is found, then considers the image is cloneable,
or considers it is not cloneable. Here has a problem, if cinder and
glance use different sheepdog cluster, this may lead the image is
always cloneable. In fact, it should use addr of cinder backend to
find the image volume, not the glance backend.

2.The driver uses 'dog vdi list volumename' command to find a volume,
if the command don't return an err, then considers the volume already
exists. This means that it assumes the command would return an err
code if the volume is not exists. But this is not the fact. Dog
command always returns 0 no matter the volume exists or not:
test for a existent volume:
$ dog vdi list test01 -r
= test01 0 4294967296 0 0 1469012083 40687a 3
$ echo $?
0
test for a nonexistent volume, return 0 and output nothing:
$ dog vdi list testvolume -r
$ echo $?
0

This patch fixed these two bugs.

Change-Id: I17a8a29be5c1d994ad36a70b2f76000f9566fbde
Closes-Bug: #1604740

' 'vdi: %(vdiname)s'), {'vdiname': vdiname}) return _stdout # The image location would be like # "sheepdog://192.168.10.2:7000:Alice" (ip, port, name) = image_location[len(prefix):].split(":", 2) stdout = self.client.get_vdi_info(name) # Dog command return 0 and has a null output if the volume not exists if stdout: return True else: LOG.debug("Can not find vdi %(image)s, is not cloneable", {'image': name}) return False
deleted_lines: cloneable = False try: # The image location would be like # "sheepdog://192.168.10.2:7000:Alice" (ip, port, name) = image_location[len(prefix):].split(":", 2) self._try_execute('collie', 'vdi', 'list', '--address', ip, '--port', port, name) cloneable = True except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: LOG.debug("Can not find vdi %(image)s: %(err)s", {'image': name, 'err': e}) return cloneable

commit_message:
numa: remove the redundant check for hw_cpu/hw_mem list

we use a hw_numa_mem/cpu_set to check the hw_numa_mem/cpu list is
empty or not, actually, we only need to use 'if' to check the list
if empty. don't need the redundant flag. so remove it.

Change-Id: If81c842a05eecd5257c59c9324c3341be803e3d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/348193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update the Tempest Test README for devstack

Update doc on how to locally run tempest tests from using
monasca-vagrant to devstack

Change-Id: Iac9d172eebe149c9f91794a2ef2cdaf9372fbfe3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/41/345641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Currently the devstack environment is needed to run the tests. Instructions on setting up a devstack environment can be found here: https://github.com/openstack/monasca-api/devstack/README.md. Add the following sections to ```tempest.conf``` for testing using the devstack environment.username = mini-mon password = password tenant_name = mini-mon domain_name = Default admin_username = admin admin_password = secretadmin admin_domain_name = Default admin_tenant_name = admin alt_username = mini-mon alt_password = password alt_tenant_name = mini-mon use_ssl = False auth_version = v3 uri = http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/ uri_v3 = http://127.0.0.1:35357/v3/ Edit the the variable values in the identity section to match your particular environment.
deleted_lines: Currently the monasca-vagrant environment is needed to run the tests. Instructions on setting up a monasca-vagrant environment can be found here: https://github.com/openstack/monasca-vagrant. This document will be updated when the environment is switched to the DevStack environment. Add the following sections to ```tempest.conf``` for testing using the monasca-vagrant environment. username = mini-mon password = password tenant_name = mini-mon domain_name = default admin_username = admin admin_password = admin admin_domain_name = default admin_tenant_name = admin alt_username = mini-mon alt_password = password alt_tenant_name = mini-mon use_ssl = False auth_version = v3 uri = http://192.168.10.5:5000/v2.0/ uri_v3 = http://192.168.10.5:35357/v3/ Edit the the variable values in the identity section to match your particular monasca-vagrant environment.

commit_message:
Update the keystone-policy spec

Updates based on face-to-face discussions with Jay Faulker, clarifying
the proposed changes.

Change-Id: Ief704c0256346c2d75844d62a96e8bebebb858d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/39/345039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Define policy rules for each RESTful action on each API endpoint, scoped to the 'baremetal' namespace. configdrives and passwords. Default to hide all sensitive information. * Define sane default policies in code [0]_ , with shipped roles including an admin role with full access and an observer role with read-only access to non-secret information. Names for these roles will be determined during implementation. A sample policy.json [1]_ shall be generatable using oslopolicy-sample-generator. * Maintain compatibility with all roles in the previously-shipped policy.json configuration file.
deleted_lines: configdrives and passwords. * Define a simple, sane default policy in code [0]_ , with shipped roles including an admin role with full access; an observer role with read-only access to non-secret information; and a role designed for use by the nova driver, with only access to endpoints required for ironic integration with nova. Names for these roles will be determined during implementation and will be configurable by deployers via policy.json [1]_ .

commit_message:
Add support for oslo.context 2.6.0

The 2.6.0 release of oslo.context adds a new attribute
'is_admin_project'.  Always include that attribute when serializing the
object, and expect it in our tests.

Change-Id: I563cf810385e84ab30d49ef079b75df279006f0d
Related-Bug: 1602081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/342604/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'is_admin_project': True, 'is_admin_project': True,

subject: Fix xtrabackup-binlog file GTID parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 19:15:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/52efa186a27a0dbe236c69f599ede48eda91fa90', 'message': 'Fix xtrabackup-binlog file GTID parsing

The code responsible for pulling the last GTID reference from
snapshot backup restored to the replica only handled the case
where the GTID reference contained one gtid. There are common
replication use cases where the GTID reference in the file is
comma separated list of GTID references. Change the code from
using the CSV reader to just read the entire file and split it
on tabs. This will guarantee that we get the full list of GTID
references in the file.

Change-Id: Ibbde5a4daa9741e1b997a618288bf6d469356bfe
Closes-bug: 1604914
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 19:26:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/336503c56b75e39fcfeead3e8f29a8d19538fb79', 'message': 'Fix xtrabackup-binlog file GTID parsing

The code responsible for pulling the last GTID reference from
snapshot backup restored to the replica only handled the case
where the GTID reference contained one gtid. There are common
replication use cases where the GTID reference in the file is
comma separated list of GTID references. Change the code from
using the CSV reader to just read the entire file and split it
on tabs. This will guarantee that we get the full list of GTID
references in the file.

Change-Id: Ibbde5a4daa9741e1b997a618288bf6d469356bfe
Closes-bug: 1604914

commit_message:
Fix xtrabackup-binlog file GTID parsing

The code responsible for pulling the last GTID reference from
snapshot backup restored to the replica only handled the case
where the GTID reference contained one gtid. There are common
replication use cases where the GTID reference in the file is
comma separated list of GTID references. Change the code from
using the CSV reader to just read the entire file and split it
on tabs. This will guarantee that we get the full list of GTID
references in the file.

Change-Id: Ibbde5a4daa9741e1b997a618288bf6d469356bfe
Closes-bug: 1604914

commit_message:
Moved ipv4 & ipv6 validations to the common utils

Validating ip addresses for ipv4 and ipv6 formats have more generic
use cases outside of rings. swift-get-nodes and other utilities that
need to handle ipv6 adrresses often require importing ip validation
methods from swift/common/rings/utils (see Related-Change). Also,
expand_ipv6 method already exists in swift/common/utils. Hence moving
validation of ips also into swift/common/utils from
swift/common/ring/utils.

Related-Change: I6551d65241950c65e7160587cc414deb4a2122f5
Change-Id: I720a9586469cf55acab74b4b005907ce106b3da4

commit_message:
Use self.ts more consistently in obj.test_server

A make_timestamp_iter was added into setUp in the Related-Change.

There was a couple of different tests that were using timestamp iters
in different ways, consistently we apply the use of next(self.ts)
which I believe is becoming more common/standardized in unitests.

Related-Change: I074fbecb6440fb1d04279cd892d38d2acc44b47d
Change-Id: Ib6b883afec242355ae08c50c1e685a20e5efadc7

Additional test for container override etag preferences

Adds one more scenario to the tests for preference of
container etag override values in sysmeta or backend
headers and footers.

Related-Change: I074fbecb6440fb1d04279cd892d38d2acc44b47d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 19:25:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/4790a1b4ef3a16da85fc4dfa12211c58aea54f83', 'message': "Split up backend/sysmeta header/footer preference tests

The change in preference to the dependent patch is simply to prefer
sysmeta overrides in the headers to bacend overrides in the footers:

Before:

After:

be that overrides in sysmeta headers only work on policies that don't
send backend footers, but sysmeta overrides should always have a
higher preference than backend overrides.

commit_message:
Split up backend/sysmeta header/footer preference tests

The change in preference to the Related-Change is simply to prefer
sysmeta overrides in the headers to backend overrides in the footers:

Before:
sysmeta footers > backend footers > sysmeta headers > backend headers

After:
sysmeta footers > sysmeta headers > backend footers > backend headers

This change just breaks up the tests to try to make it more obvious
what already worked and what has changed.  The justification seems to
be that overrides in sysmeta headers only work on policies that don't
send backend footers, but sysmeta overrides should always have a
higher preference than backend overrides.

Related-Change: Idb40361ac72da51e1390dff690723dbc2c653a13
Change-Id: I074fbecb6440fb1d04279cd892d38d2acc44b47d

commit_message:
clean up release tool output

Now that the release tools are running in CI, some of the echo
statements we had in place for debugging during a manual run are
redundant with the "bash -x" mode. This change also removes the special
"title" function and replaces some of those calls with simpler echo
calls.

Change-Id: Ib70293f78078d91ebe0cc3f693d7bdefb7659041
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove oslo-incubator

Oslo-incubator has been deprecated. The only thing that we use from it
is the memorycache which is hopefully going away soon. Copy this
memorycache code into the _cache module so that we can refactor it as
necessary without worrying about oslo-incubator.

Involves some minor cleanups for pep8 fixes and making functions
private.

Change-Id: I7a19d4ded8b538b6ea02e4a08068c863705194a3

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Super simple fake memcache client.""" import copy from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_utils import timeutils memcache_opts = [ cfg.ListOpt('memcached_servers', help='Memcached servers or None for in process cache.'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(memcache_opts) def list_opts(): """Entry point for oslo-config-generator.""" return [(None, copy.deepcopy(memcache_opts))] def get_client(memcached_servers=None): client_cls = Client if not memcached_servers: memcached_servers = CONF.memcached_servers if memcached_servers: import memcache client_cls = memcache.Client return client_cls(memcached_servers, debug=0) class Client(object): """Replicates a tiny subset of memcached client interface.""" def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): """Ignores the passed in args.""" self.cache = {} def get(self, key): """Retrieves the value for a key or None. This expunges expired keys during each get. """ now = timeutils.utcnow_ts() for k in list(self.cache): (timeout, _value) = self.cache[k] if timeout and now >= timeout: del self.cache[k] return self.cache.get(key, (0, None))[1] def set(self, key, value, time=0, min_compress_len=0): """Sets the value for a key.""" timeout = 0 if time != 0: timeout = timeutils.utcnow_ts() + time self.cache[key] = (timeout, value) return True def add(self, key, value, time=0, min_compress_len=0): """Sets the value for a key if it doesn't exist.""" if self.get(key) is not None: return False return self.set(key, value, time, min_compress_len) def incr(self, key, delta=1): """Increments the value for a key.""" value = self.get(key) if value is None: return None new_value = int(value) + delta self.cache[key] = (self.cache[key][0], str(new_value)) return new_value def delete(self, key, time=0): """Deletes the value associated with a key.""" if key in self.cache: del self.cache[key]

subject: Fix the mechanism used to avoid duplicate script names in job binaries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-14 11:16:05.000000000', 'files': ['sahara_dashboard/content/data_processing/jobs/job_binaries/forms.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard/commit/721f6109eeafeee8cee22e1d8bf754a5d9e09abc', 'message': 'Fix the mechanism used to avoid duplicate script names in job binaries

Create a Job Binary in the internal db, with a specific script name.
If the user creates another job binary with the same script name,
a unique UUID is added so that the name is unique.

Now unique UUID is too long. I set 8 characters as length of this UUID.
Also I check length of result unique name. If it is larger than 80, result

Change-Id: Ie89601dd23a00433bd78efd7fb15fa6afc2b28f0
Closes-bug: 1427328
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the mechanism used to avoid duplicate script names in job binaries

Create a Job Binary in the internal db, with a specific script name.
If the user creates another job binary with the same script name,
a unique UUID is added so that the name is unique.

Now unique UUID is too long. I set 8 characters as length of this UUID.
Also I check length of result unique name. If it is larger than 80, result
name will be cut short and length will be 80.

Change-Id: Ie89601dd23a00433bd78efd7fb15fa6afc2b28f0
Closes-bug: 1427328
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/80/329380/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if base_name in names: return "%s_%s" % (base_name, uuid.uuid1())

commit_message:
Remove deprecated oslo messaging options

Several oslo_messaging_rabbit options are deprecated and replaced
by transport_url which is already defined in the aodh.conf template.

These are emitting warnings into the aodh-listener.log file.

Change-Id: I96e33a31f503864d087e35d07ea18dcfd375cea3

commit_message:
Removing old-new password matches validation from keystoneclient

This patches removes the check that the old password doesn't match
new password when updating a password in keystoneclient. With the
addition of PCI, this check should no longer be needed and instead
keystoneclient can rely on keystone to perform this validaton.

Change-Id: I8913337a69c010d7e62e3d67156aedceb3164815
Closes-Bug: #1607436

remove note about experimental APIs from landing page

"experimental" APIs are keystone specific, I've made the
change to include them in our v3 APIs (they do not apply
to v2 APIs) over here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347947/

commit_message:
Handle deletion of tap device from bridge

Virtual machine deletion fails during the deletion of
tap device from Linux bridge. This happens if for some reason
the tap device was not configured with the bridge.

Closes-Bug: #1597054
Change-Id: I7246cd6ece1d8723974e6b29825f62de52c99369

Add node.resource_class field

This adds the "resource_class" field to the node table, object, and API,
as well as a database migration to go with it.

commit_message:
Allow passing a "insecure" flag in trusts

Keystone deployments can be on self signed certs, which will fail
on verifying the cert on client side. This patch allows an user
to turn off cert verification.

Partially-Closes: #1597995

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1e1298b96ea6ec499f55230325c867b81d38a243

subject: Add run_nova_cmd function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 15:47:14.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_util_nova.py', 'octane/util/nova.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane/commit/f57b22bb5534e8843648f46db2953320310c3719', 'message': 'Add run_nova_cmd function

This is required for running nova command on contoller without
manipulating manipulating with command.

It makes code easier and more readable

Usage:

    from fuelclient.objects import environment as environment_obj

    from octane.util import env
    from octane.util import nova

    env_id = ...
    my_env = environment_obj.Environment(env_id)
    controller = env.get_one_controller(my_env)
    nova_cmd_just_run = [...]
    nova_cmd_with_output = [...]
    nova.run_nova_cmd(nova_cmd_just_run, controller, False)
    result = nova.run_nova_cmd(nova_cmd_with_output, controller, True)

Change-Id: Icf14b968a372e07bab9517191380e67074aae4ce
(cherry picked from commit fb582b271dab4bdd10d27149a77c0e1f6a580b9e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add run_nova_cmd function

This is required for running nova command on contoller without
manipulating manipulating with command.

It makes code easier and more readable

Usage:

    from fuelclient.objects import environment as environment_obj

    from octane.util import env
    from octane.util import nova

    env_id = ...
    my_env = environment_obj.Environment(env_id)
    controller = env.get_one_controller(my_env)
    nova_cmd_just_run = [...]
    nova_cmd_with_output = [...]
    nova.run_nova_cmd(nova_cmd_just_run, controller, False)
    result = nova.run_nova_cmd(nova_cmd_with_output, controller, True)

Change-Id: Icf14b968a372e07bab9517191380e67074aae4ce
(cherry picked from commit fb582b271dab4bdd10d27149a77c0e1f6a580b9e)

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from octane.util import ssh def run_nova_cmd(cmd, node, output=True): run_cmd = ['sh', '-c', ' '.join(['.', '/root/openrc;'] + cmd)] if output: return ssh.call_output(run_cmd, node=node) return ssh.call(run_cmd, node=node)

commit_message:
Move constraints to their respective services

The openstack-core-then-httpd constraint needs to live in the apache
pacemaker manifest and not in the main controller manifest file.
The same goes for those specific vsm/cisco neutron resources.

Change-Id: Ifce6c253db004a98f8feb51b84a2f1731253f178
Depends-On: I2041d4d163f051427b62eec07b8345ad7006cc1d

commit_message:
Add HipChat and Slack Notification types

This patch
   1. Supports for loading new notification types as plugins.
   2) Adds new plugins for HipChat and Slack
   3) Insert Notification types during startup

Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin
Change-Id: I246ced3fe22a9797a3c8384f7bda166797cfac3a

added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2015 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import json import requests from abstract_notifier import AbstractNotifier class SlackNotifier(AbstractNotifier): def __init__(self, log): self._log = log def config(self, config_dict): self._config = {'timeout': 5} self._config.update(config_dict) @property def type(self): return "slack" @property def statsd_name(self): return 'sent_slack_count' def build_slack_message(self, notificaiton): """ Builds slack messgae body """ message_body = json.loads(notificaiton) slack_request = {} slack_request['text'] = json.dumps(message_body, indent=3) return slack_request def send_notification(self, notification): """Send the notification via hipchat Posts on the given url """ slack_message = self.build_slack_message(notification) https_proxy = self._config.get("https_proxy", None) proxyDict = { "https" : https_proxy, } query_params = {} query_params['token'] = self._config['token'] query_params['channel'] = self._config['channel_name'] headers = {'content-type': 'application/json'} url_format = 'https://{0}/api/chat.postMessage' url = url_format.format(notification.address) try: # Posting on the given URL result = requests.post(url =url, data = slack_message, verify=False, headers=headers, proxies=proxyDict, params=query_params, timeout=self._config['timeout']) if result.status_code in range(200, 300): self._log.info("Notification successfully posted.") return True else: self._log.error("Received an HTTP code {} when trying to send to slack on URL {}." .format(result.status_code, url)) return False except Exception: self._log.exception("Error trying to send to slack on URL {}".format(url)) return False

commit_message:
Backup tests verify restored databases

The backup scenario tests currently only
verify data in the helper database.
We should also make sure no other databases
are created or deleted in the process.

Also removed a leftover mixin class.
That code was not used anywhere.

Also change the base instance name pattern
to allow selecting the name by double-clicking it.
(Linux bash stops at ':', and Mac equvalent stops at
':' and '-'. Windows shell always selects the whole
thing.)

Change-Id: I01ad0472bde59a95c619fb881cef976937b79fa6

gate-project-config-layout should use ubuntu-trusty

this on ubuntu-trusty since zuul.o.o is running on ubuntu-trusty.

commit_message:
Revert "Explicitly set $FACTER_fqdn"

This was actually related to a bug in tripleo-test-cloud-rh2 and
nodepool.o.o. The nodes we launched did not have config-drive properly
setup which resulted in glean not properly setting up the hostname of
a node.

This reverts commit 6058e39c9804fc566936f2a4dbde9597e7c255f9.

Change-Id: Ic615fabea42973492eee563a72d9cf27c297d7f5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Reduce ovh-gra1 to 40 nodes"

This reverts commit 1ac1ede39223c7d2d1daf1a7939005925d4f089a.

OVH has corrected the problem with bad quota accounting on their end.
Bump max-servers back up to use the total real quota.

Change-Id: I687ac7cf1d790dca2bf88f23fc0e9551a8536c83

revisions:

The API was not allowing the deletion of load balancers in ERROR state.

commit_message:
Allow deletion of ERRORed load balancers

The API was not allowing the deletion of load balancers in ERROR state.
Users should be able to delete their load balancers in ACTIVE or ERROR
state.  This is good for users and good for operators.

Change-Id: Ie40b062e1b5cc6d90274190676fb81ee1c32e63e
Closes-Bug: #1607502

commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages

Some Linux distribution releases, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have
trouble validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds packages for those distributions that allow Python
to validate connections with servers using SNI.

Change-Id: I0b74b894c46d61129e1c3ec5eba1d567e268b7ab

commit_message:
Add doc entry to check partition count

An high or increasing partition count due to storing handoffs can have
some severe side-effects, and replication might never be able to catch
up. This patch adds a note to the admin_guide how to check this.

Change-Id: Ib4e161d68f1a82236dbf5fac13ef9a13ac4bbf18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/89/327489/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: your replicators are transferring it to NY, then your cluster's data distributionYou can check if handoff partitions are piling up on a server by comparing the expected number of partitions with the actual number on your disks. First get the number of partitions that is currently assigned to a server using the ``dispersion`` command from ``swift-ring-builder``:: swift-ring-builder /etc/swift/object.builder dispersion -v r1z1-172.16.10.5 Now count the number of object partitions on that server:: find -L /srv/node/ -maxdepth 3 -type d -wholename "*objects/*" | wc -l With write_affinity enabled it is expected to have a higher number of partitions on disk compared to the value reported by the swift-ring-builder command. The amount of additional (handoff) partitions in region r1 and r2 depends on your cluster size, the amount of incoming data as well as the replication speed. Let's assume you have 6 nodes in 3 regions, and write_affinity is configured to write to region r1 and r2 first. swift-ring-builder reported that each node should store ~1365 partitions and there are 3 replicas. Expected partitions for 2 nodes in region r3: 2 x 1365 = 2730 Handoffs stored across 4 nodes in region r1 and r2: 2730 / 4 ~ 683 Maximum number of partitions in region r1 and r2: 1365 + 683 = 2048 Worst case is that replication never finishes and region r1 and r2 store all handoff partitions. In that case you will see ~ 2048 partitions per server in region r1 and r2. Your actual number should be lower and between 1365 and 2048 partitions (preferably on the lower side). If the number is always on the upper end or increasing you should check your replication speed and maybe even disable write_affinity.
deleted_lines: your link to NY can transfer it, then your cluster's data distribution

commit_message:
Allow V2TestCase to be tested against fernet and uuid

This helps make our switch to fernet as the default token provider easier.

This is an effort to break https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 into
smaller, more reviewable pieces.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I67121265cf06eb11586c90c37c6439bcdb28acf0
Partial-Bug: 1561054

commit_message:
Make AuthWithTrust testable against uuid and fernet

We should make AuthWithTrust something that is tested against both the uuid
token provider and the fernet token provider. This helps us move towards making
fernet the default token provider.

This is an effort to break https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 into
smaller, more reviewable pieces.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0fd2187421fc677e7d422d4b449eec3056a134e9

added_lines: import freezegunclass AuthWithTrust(object):class UUIDAuthWithTrust(AuthWithTrust, AuthTest): def config_overrides(self): super(UUIDAuthWithTrust, self).config_overrides() self.config_fixture.config(group='token', provider='uuid') def setUp(self): super(UUIDAuthWithTrust, self).setUp() class FernetAuthWithTrust(AuthWithTrust, AuthTest): def config_overrides(self): super(FernetAuthWithTrust, self).config_overrides() self.config_fixture.config(group='token', provider='fernet') self.useFixture(ksfixtures.KeyRepository(self.config_fixture)) def setUp(self): super(FernetAuthWithTrust, self).setUp() def test_delete_tokens_for_user_invalidates_tokens_from_trust(self): msg = 'The Fernet token provider does not support token persistence' self.skipTest(msg) def test_delete_trust_revokes_token(self): unscoped_token = self.get_unscoped_token(self.trustor['name']) new_trust = self.create_trust(self.sample_data, self.trustor['name']) request = self._create_auth_request( unscoped_token['access']['token']['id']) trust_token_resp = self.fetch_v2_token_from_trust(new_trust) trust_id = new_trust['id'] self.trust_controller.delete_trust(request, trust_id=trust_id) # FIXME(lbragstad): For some reason this returns a Forbidden # instead of a NotFound(?!) self.assertRaises( exception.Forbidden, self.controller.validate_token, self.make_request(), trust_token_resp['access']['token']['id'] ) def test_token_from_trust_cant_get_another_token(self): new_trust = self.create_trust(self.sample_data, self.trustor['name']) auth_response = self.fetch_v2_token_from_trust(new_trust) trust_token_id = auth_response['access']['token']['id'] request_body = _build_user_auth(token={'id': trust_token_id}, tenant_id=self.tenant_bar['id']) # FIXME(lbragstad): This should return an Unauthorized. self.controller.authenticate(self.make_request(), request_body) def test_trust_get_token_fails_if_trustee_disabled(self): time = datetime.datetime.utcnow() with freezegun.freeze_time(time) as frozen_time: new_trust = self.create_trust(self.sample_data, self.trustor['name']) request_body = self.build_v2_token_request( self.trustee['name'], self.trustee['password'], new_trust) self.disable_user(self.trustee) frozen_time.tick(delta=datetime.timedelta(seconds=1)) self.assertRaises( exception.Forbidden, self.controller.authenticate, self.make_request(), request_body) self.assertEqual( timeutils.parse_isotime(original_expiration), timeutils.parse_isotime(r['access']['token']['expires']) ) self.assertEqual( timeutils.parse_isotime(original_expiration), timeutils.parse_isotime(r['access']['token']['expires']) )

commit_message:
Update RequestSpec nested flavor when a resize comes in

There was a regression (because of a PEBKAC) when we implemented calling the
original RequestSpec because we weren't updating the flavor so the scheduler
was verifying the original flavor instead of the new one.

Change-Id: I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579
Closes-Bug: #1606269
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/87/347387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure we hydrate a new RequestSpec object with the new flavor # and not the nested one from the instance flavor, instance.numa_topology, instance.pci_requests, else: # NOTE(sbauza): Resizes means new flavor, so we need to update the # original RequestSpec object for make sure the scheduler verifies # the right one and not the original flavor request_spec.flavor = flavor # NOTE(sbauza): Make sure we persist the new flavor in case we had # a successful scheduler call if and only if nothing bad happened if request_spec.obj_what_changed(): request_spec.save()

commit_message:
Migrate image client group to client factory

Migrate the service clients in the image group to the new client
factory. The client factory for image was already available;
this change simply makes the client attributes in clients
use the factory rather than instantiating new clients.

With this approach the attributes (e.g. image_client etc) stay
on the tempest side. I don't want to make the existing names a stable
interface.

Setting the client attributes in _set_image_clients kills the lazy
loading provided by the client factory, but it's an intermediate step
towards it. Next patch will move to actual lazy loading of image
clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor
Change-Id: I6c3d604e63dbe1cbe30a4bac333f1b8d471ee543

deleted_lines: from tempest.services.image.v1.json.images_client import ImagesClient from tempest.services.image.v2.json.images_client import ImagesClientV2 for group in [compute, network, volume, volumev2, object_storage]: if CONF.service_available.glance: self.image_client = ImagesClient( self.auth_provider, CONF.image.catalog_type, CONF.image.region or CONF.identity.region, endpoint_type=CONF.image.endpoint_type, build_interval=CONF.image.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.image.build_timeout, **self.default_params) self.image_client_v2 = ImagesClientV2( self.auth_provider, CONF.image.catalog_type, CONF.image.region or CONF.identity.region, endpoint_type=CONF.image.endpoint_type, build_interval=CONF.image.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.image.build_timeout, **self.default_params) for group in [compute, network, volume, volumev2, object_storage]:

commit_message:
Migrate network client group to client factory

Migrate the service clients in the network group to the new client
factory. The client factory for network was already available;
this change simply makes the client attributes in clients
use the factory rather than instantiating new clients.

With this approach the attributes (e.g. networks_client etc) stay
on the tempest side. I don't want to make the existing names a stable
interface.

Setting the client attributes in _set_network_clients kills the lazy
loading provided by the client factory, but it's an intermediate step
towards it. Next patch will move to actual lazy loading of network
clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

Change-Id: I2cefbeec66dfdd25a2ae90554904b3c315f0b457
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/67/261067/27 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.services.network.json.floating_ips_client import \ FloatingIPsClient as FloatingIPSClient from tempest.services.network.json.metering_label_rules_client import \ MeteringLabelRulesClient from tempest.services.network.json.metering_labels_client import \ MeteringLabelsClient from tempest.services.network.json.network_client import NetworkClient from tempest.services.network.json.networks_client import NetworksClient from tempest.services.network.json.ports_client import PortsClient from tempest.services.network.json.quotas_client import QuotasClient from tempest.services.network.json.security_groups_client import \ SecurityGroupsClient from tempest.services.network.json.subnets_client import SubnetsClient name = 'network' description = 'Collection of service clients for the network APIs' service_clients = [FloatingIPSClient, MeteringLabelRulesClient, MeteringLabelsClient, NetworkClient, NetworksClient, PortsClient, QuotasClient, SecurityGroupsClient, SubnetsClient] group_params = ['service', 'region', 'endpoint_type', 'build_interval', 'build_timeout'] client_params = {}

subject: Migrate compute client group to client factory

"}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2016-06-21 14:26:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6a3dd8905126e5157455046d912d2b4dcb72ab8a', 'message': "Migrate compute client group to the new manager

Migrate the service clients in the compute group to the
new client manager.

Note that starting with this change compute clients will
start to be available in manager.Manager for clients
consuming that directly. The setup of those clients though
will be based on the defaults defined in lib_manager and
not tempest.conf. manager.Manager is provided for backward
compatibility only (even if it wasn't a stable interface)
to ensure a smooth transition to the stable interface for
plugin clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

Change-Id: Icdc1a40dbb1220c8e190ca5831058ac4d72cc34a

factory. The client factory for compute was already available;
this change simply makes the client attributes in clients
use the factory rather than instantiating new clients.

With this approach the attributes (e.g. servers_client etc) stay
on the tempest side. I don't want to make the existing names a stable
interface.

commit_message:
Migrate compute client group to client factory

Migrate the service clients in the compute group to the new client
factory. The client factory for compute was already available;
this change simply makes the client attributes in clients
use the factory rather than instantiating new clients.

With this approach the attributes (e.g. servers_client etc) stay
on the tempest side. I don't want to make the existing names a stable
interface.

Setting the client attributes in _set_compute_clients kills the lazy
loading provided by the client factory, but it's an intermediate step
towards it. Next patch will move to actual lazy loading of compute
clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

Change-Id: Icdc1a40dbb1220c8e190ca5831058ac4d72cc34a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/77/260077/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest_lib.services.compute.fixed_ips_client import FixedIPsClient as \ FixedIPSClient FloatingIPsBulkClient as FloatingIPSBulkClient FloatingIPsClient as ComputeFloatingIPSClient from tempest.services.compute.json.keypairs_client import KeyPairsClient as \ KeypairsClient # Compute service clients group compute_client = { 'description': 'Collection of service clients for the compute APIs', 'group_params': ['service', 'region', 'endpoint_type', 'build_interval', 'build_timeout'], 'service_clients': [AgentsClient, ComputeNetworksClient, MigrationsClient, SecurityGroupDefaultRulesClient, CertificatesClient, ServersClient, ServerGroupsClient, LimitsClient, ComputeImagesClient, KeypairsClient, QuotasClient, QuotaClassesClient, FlavorsClient, ExtensionsClient, FloatingIPPoolsClient, FloatingIPSBulkClient, ComputeFloatingIPSClient, SecurityGroupRulesClient, ComputeSecurityGroupsClient, InterfacesClient, FixedIPSClient, AvailabilityZoneClient, AggregatesClient, ServicesClient, TenantUsagesClient, HostsClient, HypervisorClient, InstanceUsagesAuditLogClient, TenantNetworksClient, BaremetalNodesClient, ComputeVolumesClient, VersionsClient, ComputeSnapshotsClient]} # NOTE Client specs serve the purpose of defining client specific # attributes, i.e. 'alias' and 'client_params'. An alias is a client name # that will be used for the client attribute name on the Clients object. # Aliases are required to avoid name conflicts, e.g. between compute API # VolumeClient and volume API VolumeClient. Client params are used to # specify parameters that a client expects, that are not shared by the # entire service client group. There is one client_specs for all groups. _client_specs = { ComputeNetworksClient: {'alias': 'compute_networks'}, ComputeVolumesClient: {'alias': 'volumes_extensions'}, VersionsClient: {'alias': 'compute_versions'}, ComputeSnapshotsClient: {'alias': 'snapshots_extensions'}, ServersClient: {'client_params': ['enable_instance_password']}} # NOTE(andreaf) This list may only change if the scope of tempest changes # from the current six core client groups. Any extra client needs to # be registered. # TODO(andreaf) Migrate the other five core client groups. _clients = {'compute': compute_client} # Use lazy load for most compute clients self.set_compute_params(**params) eip = CONF.compute_feature_enabled.enable_instance_password self.set_client_params('servers', enable_instance_password=eip) self.set_client_params('volumes_extensions', build_interval=CONF.volume.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.volume.build_timeout) self.set_client_params('compute_versions', build_interval=CONF.volume.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.volume.build_timeout) self.set_client_params('snapshots_extensions', build_interval=CONF.volume.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.volume.build_timeout)

self.baremetal_nodes_client = BaremetalNodesClient( self.auth_provider, **params) params_volume = copy.deepcopy(params) params_volume.update({ 'build_interval': CONF.volume.build_interval, 'build_timeout': CONF.volume.build_timeout }) self.volumes_extensions_client = ComputeVolumesClient( self.auth_provider, **params_volume) self.compute_versions_client = commit_message:
Register Tempest clients via the new interface

Register stable Tempest service clients in ServiceClients using the
same interface used by plugin service clients. Stable clients are
for now compute, image and network.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor
Change-Id: I1b2a0a74db7b7cfd8bfc93cbb0ca3a7341f2c898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/335242/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib.services import compute from tempest.lib.services import image from tempest.lib.services import network # Register service clients owned by tempest # Compute self.register_service_client_module( 'compute', 'compute', compute.__name__, compute.__all__, self.parameters['compute']) # Image self.register_service_client_module( 'image', 'image_v1', image.v1.__name__, image.v1.__all__, self.parameters['image']) self.register_service_client_module( 'image', 'image_v2', image.v2.__name__, image.v2.__all__, self.parameters['image']) # Networks self.register_service_client_module( 'network', 'network', network.__name__, network.__all__, self.parameters['network'])

commit_message:
Service Clients registration interface for plugins

Add a new registration interface to service_clients.
Add a new optional method to the plugin interface, that exposes
the plugin service client registration details.

Tests in plugins can initialise service_clients with parmaters
common to their service clients and other ones they may need.
Parameters specific to their service clients are passed via the
registration interface, and can be overwritten at any time
by passing extra parameters at client init time.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor
Change-Id: I2d99aaa317b0d21c0968dd25b21c4ba9088136fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/13/333513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def register_service_client_module(self, name, module): """Register a service client module Initiates a client factory for the specified module, using this class auth_provider, and accessible via a `name` attribute in the service client. :param name: Name used to access the client :param module: Module object that includes all service clients """ if hasattr(self, name): raise TypeError()

subject: Refactoring config options for common config opts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 14:51:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/346ef4d2d9db047b5bbc7f6ca71d6662f75efd7a', 'message': 'Refactoring config options for common config opts

Refactoring neutron common config opts to be in neutron/conf/common so that all
the configuration options reside in a centralized location. This simplifies the
process of looking up the config opts and provides an easy way to import.

Partial-Bug: #1563069

commit_message:
Refactoring config options for common config opts

Refactoring neutron common config opts to be in neutron/conf/common so
that all the configuration options reside in a centralized location.
This simplifies the process of looking up the config opts and provides
an easy way to import.

Moved conf/common/config.py to conf/common.py as per review comments.

Partial-Bug: #1563069

Change-Id: Ib5fa294906549237630f87b9c848eebe0644088c

deleted_lines: from neutron.common import config as base_config

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix invalid test data

Fix up a couple of classes of invalid test data:

* Invalid backing file names: filenames which don't correspond to
  their instance.

* Invalid uuids.

This change is not intended to be comprehensive: it only touches tests
which are affected by the storage refactor series.

Change-Id: I08daffdfd6eedfe84c7f1b010ab0fa204074ffec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/333241/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.virt.libvirt import imagecache def test_create_image_initrd(self): kernel_id = uuids.kernel_id ramdisk_id = uuids.ramdisk_id kernel_fname = imagecache.get_cache_fname(kernel_id) ramdisk_fname = imagecache.get_cache_fname(ramdisk_id) if filename in (kernel_fname, ramdisk_fname): pass instance_ref['image_ref'] = uuids.instance_id instance_ref['kernel_id'] = uuids.kernel_id instance_ref['ramdisk_id'] = uuids.ramdisk_id {'filename': kernel_fname, {'filename': ramdisk_fname, {'filename': imagecache.get_cache_fname(uuids.instance_id),
deleted_lines: @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.driver.imagecache') def test_create_image_initrd(self, mock_imagecache): INITRD = self._EPHEMERAL_20_DEFAULT + '.initrd' KERNEL = 'vmlinuz.' + self._EPHEMERAL_20_DEFAULT mock_imagecache.get_cache_fname.side_effect = \ [KERNEL, INITRD, self._EPHEMERAL_20_DEFAULT + '.img'] if filename == INITRD: if filename == KERNEL: outer.assertEqual(fetch_func, fake_libvirt_utils.fetch_raw_image) instance_ref['image_ref'] = 1 instance_ref['kernel_id'] = 2 instance_ref['ramdisk_id'] = 3 {'filename': KERNEL, {'filename': INITRD, {'filename': self._EPHEMERAL_20_DEFAULT + '.img',

subject: libvirt: Fix fake _disk_info data in LibvirtDriverTestCase
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-10 16:03:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bbd815974015dcf8f8b54d5b0d1176f35238f911', 'message': 'Fix fake data returned by LibvirtDriverTestCase._disk_info

This fake was returning dicts which were missing backing_file and
over_committed_disk_size. This change adds the missing fields with their
correct default values.

The data returned was also not related to the instance being tested.
This meant that _test_finish_migration was explicitly testing for the
wrong behaviour, as it was expecting a swap disk to be created for an
instance which did not have one.

We also fix usage of instance.config_drive, which is a StringField
despite being used as a boolean value. The False case is None. The
True case is any non-empty string. The default value produced by
_create_ephemeral was previously True, which is converted to str(True)
and evaluates to True when converted back to a boolean (N.B. not the
case for False, which also evaluates to True after this process). We
change this to None, as most tests do not expect disk_info to contain
a config drive.

Change-Id: If2ebba557b05330387141647049cf9a5cbe6aa34
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-10 16:12:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ee4113dd344991bf3fe0812cfa14472bbd1acfa0', 'message': 'Fix fake data returned by LibvirtDriverTestCase._disk_info

over_committed_disk_size. This change adds the missing fields with their
correct default values. We also move it out of LibvirtDriverTestCase
to the top level so tests in other suites can use it in future

used in subsequent tests.

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix fake _disk_info data in LibvirtDriverTestCase

This fake was returning dicts which were missing backing_file and
over_committed_disk_size. This change adds the missing fields with their
correct default values. We also move it out of LibvirtDriverTestCase
to the top level so tests in other suites can use it in future
patches.

The data returned was also not related to the instance being tested.
This meant that _test_finish_migration was explicitly testing for the
wrong behaviour, as it was expecting a swap disk to be created for an
instance which did not have one.

We also update LibvirtDriverTestCase._create_instance to use
fake_instance.fake_instance_obj, which helps avoid some accidental DB
access in tests.

Change-Id: If2ebba557b05330387141647049cf9a5cbe6aa34

tests: enable test_get_objects_queries_constant for trunk ports

Now that trunk model has a relationship for sub ports [1], this test can
be enabled.

[1] I1678301734e7f945e6f0400e62970b908da77a71

Partially-Implements: bp/adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I9406732427ba3386b86a108fd687c2a057b1a4b3

If we use v3 keystone, these information should be passed
into tacker server.

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Id0367754d3538c0e3da808521ba41b9aaa252a5f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/35/346335/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the package install state for distribution packages # Options are 'present' and 'latest' galera_client_package_state: present

commit_message:
Replace 755 permission with 644 for some .py file

Some .py files had been changed to 755 permission in past.
This proposing would remove the executing permission to them
for the purity.

Change-Id: Id77cdd18d772b4e29e90d23e7df9b55edfac46fb

commit_message:
Assign node to cluster with network template

Don't need to assign nics and bonds to netgroups
if network template has been applied to new cluster.

Change-Id: Ibd06de87964bf7a2038899d32e3d8a0189b9cbbd
Partial-bug: 1584044

commit_message:
Fix Aodh httpd binding

Force Aodh binding on LOCAL_IP so Aodh can be deployed with HAproxy,
like we do with other services.

Change-Id: I18f3ae7a096bcd05ccecdb80e80fc0589c7229ab
(cherry picked from commit b279100ddb35b4c1ad926f7c1000e29e2a833367)

added_lines: aodh::wsgi::apache::bind_host: {{LOCAL_IP}}

commit_message:
Consolidate heat fragments

In this change only configure_docker_registery.sh file has been
removed for fedora atomic k8s, coreos k8s and fedora atomic swarm
driver and put into the common.

Change-Id: Ic905ce3807483e14ab04d4d3c1e07aa1d0dbda4f
Closes-Bug: #1517218

commit_message:
Fix is_using_neutron

Recently we moved to use SessionClient with
the client plugins and it seems, just
creating the client does not ensure that the
service is available. We should check for
the endpoint.

Change-Id: Iae9fa8758314a4b04224127a181eb1054aa72d8a
Closes-Bug: #1606951

artifacts to more than one platform.

added_lines: try: except IndexError: """Drop all expired connections from the left end of the queue.""" try: while self.queue[0].ttl < now: conn = self.queue.popleft().connection self._debug_logger('Reaping connection %s', id(conn)) self._destroy_connection(conn) except IndexError: # NOTE(amakarov): This is an expected excepton. so there's no # need to react. We have to handle exceptions instead of # checking queue length as IndexError is a result of race # condition too as well as of mere queue depletio of mere queue # depletionn. pass
