commit_message:
Modify the default cpu-mode for aarh64 in Libvirt

For AArch64, KVM don't recognize the cpu-mode "none",
so change the default cpu-mode as host-passthrough for
generating nova.conf

Change-Id: I94a22e5a15a974b9c11e9f9fd996857453b6e2ca
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/53/344353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $NOVA_CONF libvirt cpu_mode "host-passthrough"

commit_message:
[WIP] patch debmirror

Change-Id: Id86127528d83a75686de93b1875ded798a579bf3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/39/348539/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: define do_debmirror set -ex; debmirror --progress --checksums --nocleanup \ --nosource --ignore-release-gpg --rsync-extra=none \ --exclude-deb-section='^debug$$' \ --method=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_METHOD) \ --host=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU) \ --root=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_ROOT) \ --dist=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_SUITE)$1 \ --section=$(subst $(space),$(comma),$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_SECTION)) \ --arch=$(UBUNTU_ARCH) \ $(LOCAL_MIRROR_UBUNTU)/ endefdefine debmirror_patch_00 cat > patch -p1 /usr/bin/debmirror << EOF diff --git a/debmirror b/debmirror index 0c2543c..f2fdd61 100755 --- a/debmirror +++ b/debmirror @@ -2116,7 +2116,7 @@ sub name_release { if ($$origin eq "none") { $$codename = $$dist_raw; - } elsif ($$origin eq "Ubuntu" or $$origin eq "Canonical") { + } elsif ($$origin eq "Ubuntu" or $$origin eq "Canonical" or $$origin eq "Mirantis") { if ($$suite) { say("Ubuntu Release file: using Suite ($$suite)."); $$codename = $$suite; EOF endif $(BUILD_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/patch_debmirror.done: sh -c "$${debmirror_patch_00}" $(ACTION.TOUCH) $(BUILD_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/mirror.done: \ $(BUILD_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/patch_debmirror.done $(call do_debmirror) $(call do_debmirror,-proposed)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-26 20:43:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/1fb8dbc3d1cd26d1d97db2fb387173e443d32615', 'message': 'Copy more headers when copying object

Fix object controller copy handling so that content-encoding,
content-disposition and any other headers that the object
server allows are copied correctly.

Add tests for this change and to verify that content-type
gets either copied or updated if supplied with the copy
request.

Remove a no-op statement that suggested that the Etag
was copied from source to destination but in fact had no
effect. Etag cannot be copied because the copy get request
may have a Range so the destination content would not equal
the source content.

Move some SLO specific header handling from the proxy object
controller to the SLO copy_hook.

Closes-Bug: #1391826

commit_message:
Copy headers correctly when copying object

Fix copy middleware so that all client-defined object
headers that object servers allow to be persisted are copied.
For example, content-encoding and content-disposition will
now be copied.

Fix treatment of x-fresh-metadata header so that, when it is
used, new object sysmeta is applied to the object copy in the
same way as a copy without x-fresh-metadata.

Remove unnecessary passing of original request headers to
sink PUT request constructor: passing the environ is sufficient
to have the new request inherit the original's headers.

Add tests for this change and to verify that content-type
gets either copied or updated if supplied with the copy
request.

Add tests for x-fresh-metadata treatment.

Closes-Bug: #1391826
Closes-Bug: #1600247
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I917fb0b4e831c13e04ade1c5e0b9821802dec967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/24/272724/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fresh_meta_flag = config_true_value( sink_req.headers.get('x-fresh-metadata', 'false')) # the sink_req has already been initialised with the original req's # headers, now we decide what updates to make to those headers if fresh_meta_flag or 'swift.post_as_copy' in sink_req.environ: # post-as-copy: ignore new sysmeta, copy existing sysmeta condition = lambda k: (is_sys_meta('object', k) or k.lower() == 'content-length') remove_items(sink_req.headers, condition) copy_header_subset(source_resp, sink_req, condition) else: # first copy existing sysmeta, user meta and other object headers # from the source to the sink; exclude content-type which is # handled conditionally below; exclude etag because the GET may # have been ranged so the etag would not match the actual content. do_not_copy_headers = ['x-object-manifest', 'etag', 'content-type'] copy_header_subset(source_resp, sink_req, lambda k: k.lower() not in do_not_copy_headers) # now overwrite with original req headers , except content-length copy_header_subset(req, sink_req, lambda k: k.lower() != 'content-length') # we may want the source content-type after all
deleted_lines: sink_req.content_length = source_resp.content_length sink_req.etag = source_resp.etag fresh_meta_flag = config_true_value( sink_req.headers.get('x-fresh-metadata', 'false')) if fresh_meta_flag or 'swift.post_as_copy' in sink_req.environ: # post-as-copy: ignore new sysmeta, copy existing sysmeta condition = lambda k: is_sys_meta('object', k) remove_items(sink_req.headers, condition) copy_header_subset(source_resp, sink_req, condition) else: # copy/update existing sysmeta and user meta copy_headers_into(source_resp, sink_req) copy_headers_into(req, sink_req) # copy over x-static-large-object for POSTs and manifest copies if 'X-Static-Large-Object' in source_resp.headers and \ (req.params.get('multipart-manifest') == 'get' or 'swift.post_as_copy' in req.environ): sink_req.headers['X-Static-Large-Object'] = \ source_resp.headers['X-Static-Large-Object']

commit_message:
Allow dnsmasq to inject metadata route with next_hop set to VM's IP

Normally the metadata route provided for a VM has the next_hop
set to either the DHCP port IP or the gateway IP depending on
if a router is attached to the associated subnet. This change
allows the next_hop to be set as VM's IP.

This patch is for internal native metadata testing only.
It will not be merged.

Change-Id: I3a9a40ddfcadb5328f07c4288f3338626389c4a2

added_lines: if self.conf.native_metadata: for port in self.network.ports: if port.device_owner.startswith( constants.DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE_PREFIX): cmd.append('--dhcp-mac=set:%s,%s' % (port.mac_address, port.mac_address)) def _generate_static_routes(self, subnet, tag, host_routes, options): gateway = subnet.gateway_ip for hr in subnet.host_routes: if hr.destination == constants.IPv4_ANY: if hr.destination == constants.IPv4_ANY: if not gateway: gateway = hr.nexthop else: host_routes.append("%s,%s" % (hr.destination, hr.nexthop)) if not self.conf.native_metadata: if self.conf.enable_isolated_metadata or self.conf.force_metadata: subnet_to_interface_ip = self._make_subnet_interface_ip_map() isolated_subnets = self.get_isolated_subnets(self.network) # commit_message:
Initial tempest plugin framework

This patch adds initial tempest plugin support to heat integrationtest.
And also exclude heat_integrationtests from unit tests in tox env.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I9a6f7bd20a376e1c5a1ad01f6381f835e5ce52f2

commit_message:
Pecan: Fix Shim code

ShimRequest needed to expose the original attributes of the
request so the get params can be looked up by the API layer
to generate filters. It also needed to set the correct status
codes.

Change-Id: I91da522106971d34a124cdeb1ebf087fd5c4e883
Closes-bug: #TODO

subject: Have explicit jobs per test node image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 18:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/f75cb025258c91330bec34507ef9d3bda55d93f8', 'message': "Have explicit jobs per test node image

This is one of the options available for us in order to split the
stable/liberty and mitaka jobs onto Trusty and Newton/master onto
Xenial.

This setup is extremely explicit so it should be hard to accidentally
run jobs on the wrong image. The big drawback to this setup is we just
doubled the total number of jobs we have to load into our job runners.

An alternative to this method is to do what we did for the Precise and
Trusty split. During that split we had a parameter function pick the
instance type based on the branch. Unfortunately this hid the selection
logic of which instance type to use in a function that few knew existed.
This led to confusion when jobs ran on the wrong instance or showed up
as NOT_REGISTERED because zuul and the job runner didn't agree on where
the job should run.

Change-Id: I0b5efcf6c3f4ebeca5496ce22ac90dfec3291efe
"}]
commit_message:
Have explicit jobs per test node image

This is one of the options available for us in order to split the
stable/liberty and mitaka jobs onto Trusty and Newton/master onto
Xenial.

This setup is extremely explicit so it should be hard to accidentally
run jobs on the wrong image. The big drawback to this setup is we just
doubled the total number of jobs we have to load into our job runners.

An alternative to this method is to do what we did for the Precise and
Trusty split. During that split we had a parameter function pick the
instance type based on the branch. Unfortunately this hid the selection
logic of which instance type to use in a function that few knew existed.
This led to confusion when jobs ran on the wrong instance or showed up
as NOT_REGISTERED because zuul and the job runner didn't agree on where
the job should run.

Change-Id: I0b5efcf6c3f4ebeca5496ce22ac90dfec3291efe

commit_message:
List all masters when creating a pool

Slaves querying designate via the vip does not work. Explicitly listing
the slaves spreads load accross the designate units and fixes the
transfers

Change-Id: I3d2814a71116c25a555a089d724a0156383e22d3
(cherry picked from commit e65f00e90bca3a6e7c03ab63e880e95d538e6a3a)

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools
is assertEqual(expected, observed).

Closes bug: #1259292

Change-Id: Ic16cbbe2854311dcad755402363e2f72deea186e

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown,
it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I5c24d4666458a78e752d3a7957a5d895947c7fe6

added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`neutron` version ``5.0.0``. Delete all resources that belong to a given tenant. The time in milliseconds between sending probes to members. Maximum number of milliseconds for a monitor to wait for a connection to be established before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value. [--tenant-id TENANT_ID] --delay DELAY [--name NAME] --timeout TIMEOUT [--http-method HTTP_METHOD] [--url-path URL_PATH] --max-retries MAX_RETRIES [--admin-state-down] --type {PING,TCP,HTTP,HTTPS} --pool POOL``--delay DELAY`` The time in seconds between sending probes to members. Name of the health monitor. ``--timeout TIMEOUT`` Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a connection to be established before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value.``--expected-codes EXPECTED_CODES`` The list of HTTP status codes expected in response from the member to declare it healthy. This attribute can contain one value, or a list of values separated by comma, or a range of values (e.g. "200-299"). If this attribute is not specified, it defaults to "200". ``--admin-state-down`` Set admin state up to false. [--delay DELAY] [--name NAME] [--timeout TIMEOUT] [--http-method HTTP_METHOD] [--url-path URL_PATH] [--max-retries MAX_RETRIES] [--expected-codes EXPECTED_CODES] [--admin-state-up {True,False}]``--delay DELAY`` The time in seconds between sending probes to members. Name of the health monitor. ``--timeout TIMEOUT`` Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a connection to be established before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value. ``--http-method HTTP_METHOD`` The HTTP method used for requests by the monitor of type HTTP. ``--url-path URL_PATH`` The HTTP path used in the HTTP request used by the monitor to test a member health. This must be a string beginning with a / (forward slash). ``--max-retries MAX_RETRIES`` Number of permissible connection failures before changing the member status to INACTIVE. [1..10]. ``--expected-codes EXPECTED_CODES`` The list of HTTP status codes expected in response from the member to declare it healthy. This attribute can contain one value, or a list of values separated by comma, or a range of values (e.g. "200-299"). If this attribute is not specified, it defaults to "200". ``--admin-state-up {True,False}`` Update the administrative state of the health monitor (True meaning "Up"). [--description DESCRIPTION] [--default-pool DEFAULT_POOL] [--admin-state-down] [--name NAME]``--description DESCRIPTION`` Description of the listener.``--default-pool DEFAULT_POOL`` Default pool for the listener. ``--admin-state-down`` Set admin state up to false. usage: neutron lbaas-listener-update [-h] [--request-format {json}] [--description DESCRIPTION] [--connection-limit CONNECTION_LIMIT] [--default-pool DEFAULT_POOL] [--name NAME] [--admin-state-up {True,False}] LISTENER ID or name of listener to update.``--description DESCRIPTION`` Description of the listener. ``--connection-limit CONNECTION_LIMIT`` The maximum number of connections per second allowed for the vip. Positive integer or -1 for unlimited (default). ``--default-pool DEFAULT_POOL`` Default pool for the listener. ``--name NAME`` Name of the listener. ``--admin-state-up {True,False}`` Specify the administrative state of the listener. (True meaning "Up") [--name NAME] [--admin-state-down]``--admin-state-down`` Set admin state up to false. [--admin-state-up {True,False}] [--description DESCRIPTION] [--name NAME]``--admin-state-up {True,False}`` Update the administrative state of the load balancer (True meaning "Up"). ``--description DESCRIPTION`` Description of the load balancer. ``--name NAME`` Name of the load balancer. [--tenant-id TENANT_ID] [--name NAME] [--weight WEIGHT] [--admin-state-down] --subnet SUBNET --address ADDRESS --protocol-port PROTOCOL_PORT``--name NAME`` Name of the member.``--admin-state-down`` Set admin state up to false. [--admin-state-down] [--admin-state-up {True,False}] [--name NAME] [--weight WEIGHT] ID or name of the pool that this member belongs to.``--admin-state-down [DEPRECATED in Mitaka]`` Set admin state up to false. ``--admin-state-up {True,False}`` Update the administrative state of the member (True meaning "Up"). Name of the member. ``--weight WEIGHT`` Weight of member in the pool (default:1, [0..256]). deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`neutron` version ``4.2.0``.``gateway-device-create`` Create a network gateway device. ``gateway-device-delete`` Delete a given network gateway device. ``gateway-device-list`` List network gateway devices for a given tenant. ``gateway-device-show`` Show information for a given network gateway device. ``gateway-device-update`` Update a network gateway device. ``net-gateway-connect`` Add an internal network interface to a router. ``net-gateway-create`` Create a network gateway. ``net-gateway-delete`` Delete a given network gateway. ``net-gateway-disconnect`` Remove a network from a network gateway. ``net-gateway-list`` List network gateways for a given tenant. ``net-gateway-show`` Show information of a given network gateway. ``net-gateway-update`` Update the name for a network gateway. ``queue-create`` Create a queue. ``queue-delete`` Delete a given queue. ``queue-list`` List queues that belong to a given tenant. ``queue-show`` Show information of a given queue. .. _neutron_gateway-device-create: neutron gateway-device-create ----------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: neutron gateway-device-create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [--request-format {json}] [--tenant-id TENANT_ID] [--connector-type {stt,gre,ipsecgre,ipsecstt,bridge,ipsec_gre,ipsec_stt}] --connector-ip CONNECTOR_IP (--client-certificate CERT_DATA | --client-certificate-file CERT_FILE) NAME Create a network gateway device. **Positional arguments:** ``NAME`` Name of network gateway device to create. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--request-format {json}`` **DEPRECATED!** Only JSON request format is supported. ``--tenant-id TENANT_ID`` The owner tenant ID. ``--connector-type {stt,gre,ipsecgre,ipsecstt,bridge,ipsec_gre,ipsec_stt}`` Type of the transport zone connector to use for this device. Valid values are gre, stt, ipsec_gre, ipsec_stt, and bridge. Defaults to stt. ipsecgre and ipsecstt are also accepted as alternative names ``--connector-ip CONNECTOR_IP`` IP address for this device's transport connector. It must correspond to the IP address of the interface used for tenant traffic on the NSX gateway node. ``--client-certificate CERT_DATA`` PEM certificate used by the NSX gateway transport node to authenticate with the NSX controller. ``--client-certificate-file CERT_FILE`` File containing the PEM certificate used by the NSX gateway transport node to authenticate with the NSX controller. .. _neutron_gateway-device-delete: neutron gateway-device-delete ----------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: neutron gateway-device-delete [-h] [--request-format {json}] GATEWAY_DEVICE Delete a given network gateway device. **Positional arguments:** ``GATEWAY_DEVICE`` ID or name of gateway_device to delete. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--request-format {json}`` **DEPRECATED!** Only JSON request format is supported. .. _neutron_gateway-device-list: neutron gateway-device-list --------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: neutron gateway-device-list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--request-format {json}] [-D] [-F FIELD] List network gateway devices for a given tenant. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--request-format {json}`` **DEPRECATED!** Only JSON request format is supported. ``-D, --show-details`` Show detailed information. ``-F FIELD, --field FIELD`` Specify the field(s) to be returned by server. You can repeat this option. .. _neutron_gateway-device-show: neutron gateway-device-show --------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: neutron gateway-device-show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [--request-format {json}] [-D] [-F FIELD] GATEWAY_DEVICE Show information for a given network gateway device. **Positional arguments:** ``GATEWAY_DEVICE`` ID or name of gateway_device to look up. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--request-format {json}`` **DEPRECATED!** Only JSON request format is supported. ``-D, --show-details`` Show detailed information. ``-F FIELD, --field FIELD`` Specify the field(s) to be returned by server. commit_message:
Cleanup i18n marker functions to match Oslo usage

Define marker functions as per usage in documentation.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html

subject: Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 07:04:08.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/56bf5b6cd25073317f75d915c1e493ad002388cc', 'message': 'Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy

Its absence results in swift using up all the memory available to it when
certain objects are requested, we are not sure exactly what triggers the
problem but we know this fixes it.

Change-Id: Iaf00a8a2a947e0683cc60fef2e75fd7c444d07a8
Closes-Bug: #1595916
(cherry picked from commit 286b8e6f06e29450da483729acb61e0a470abc5c)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy

Its absence results in swift using up all the memory available to it when
certain objects are requested, we are not sure exactly what triggers the
problem but we know this fixes it.

commit_message:
Don't log stack trace on validation exception

This change prevents the stack trace logging when a validation
exception is raised. These exceptions are triggered by template
content, so logging a stack trace is not appropriate since the target
for the error is the end user.

Change-Id: I87ac6ab8c9ef7a53bbe039d66baaf04b8554f49e
Closes-Bug: #1606404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/22/347122/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info(_LI("Exception in stack validation: %s") % six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Don't log stack trace on resource exception

A full heat_integrationtests run should not cause heat-engine to log
anything to ERROR (even when testing error conditions, since those
errors should be targeted at the end-user).

This change prevents the stack trace logging when a resource raises an
exception during an action, since exceptions are generally used to
deliberately put the resource into an ERROR state.

Change-Id: I415089e0eae0abdfd5ab49abce81dc0bdd3e33fe
Partial-Bug: #1606404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/79/347079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info(_LI('%(action)s: %(info)s %(error)s'), "info": six.text_type(self), "error": six.text_type(ex)})

commit_message:
Explicitly set heat.conf logging_exception_prefix

Gate logs for heat jobs really need to log stack traces with TRACE
instead of ERROR because some traces are being printed by passing
exc_info=True to LOG.info so they are not actual errors.

This part of an effort to make normal heat gate jobs log nothing as
ERROR.

Change-Id: I495a81a94844b289173df659c09b05685df5b6c9
Partial-Bug: #1606404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/13/348113/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else # Ensure traces are logged as the default TRACE iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT logging_exception_prefix "%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(process)d TRACE %(name)s %(instance)s"

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate refs/changes/79/348379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Overview This charm provides the Designate (DNSaaS) for an OpenStack Cloud. # Usage Designate relies on services from the mysql, rabbitmq-server and keystone charms: juju deploy designate juju add-relation designate mysql juju add-relation designate rabbitmq-server juju add-relation designate keystone To add support for auto-generated records when guests are booted the charm needs a relation with nova-compute: juju add-relation designate nova-compute The charm needs to store DNS records. This can be achieved by setting the dns-slave config option or by relating to the designate-bind charm: juju add-relation designate designate-bind # Bugs Please report bugs on [Launchpad](https://bugs.launchpad.net/charms/+source/designate/+filebug). For general questions please refer to the OpenStack [Charm Guide](http://docs.openstack.org/developer/charm-guide/).

commit_message:
lib/neutron-legacy: replace ip when re-stacking

Replicated Yi Zhao's fix for re-adding ipv6 addresses to neutron-legacy
(review I9ff62023dbc29a88aec3c48af331c0a49a1270bb).
Previously, re-stacking failed with "File exists" for ipv6 addresses
on br-ex.  With this change, the existing address is replaced on
br-ex with the appropriate address.

Change-Id: I6e6235132a34469f4e68b5bb3cf51ebdf01c83a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/72/340172/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IP_ADD="sudo ip addr replace $IP_BRD dev $to_intf"

commit_message:
Fixing crond crashing with centos/source

This PS address the issue encountered with the latest master, crond
container's docker file did not have any logic for source type of
installation as a result no binaries were install causing container's
constant restart. Fixing logic in cron's docker file.

Change-Id: I318aa9cb16517e21e0fe58393ee577701331b077
Closes-Bug: #1607336
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/70/348270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve debug output for failed overcloud deployments

This improves the debug output by:

1. Putting all failed deployment output in a single log file
2. Pretty printing the puppet standard error using jq

For 2, it can be pretty hard to read the puppet output in the
heat deployment-show output, so by pulling it out using jq it is
much more easy to see what the actual error is.

Change-Id: Idd03cbee574e0538a1c4d7f8ea454656a9ad83f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/28/347828/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: do echo -n "heat deployment-show out put for deployment: $failed" >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log heat deployment-show $failed >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo "puppet standard error for deployment: $failed" >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log echo -e $(heat deployment-show $failed | jq .output_values.deploy_stderr) >> failed_deployments.log echo -n "######################################################" >> failed_deployments.log

commit_message:
Add facter output to host_info.txt

Being able to see all of the facter facts can help with debugging puppet
issues. This adds ~3s to get_host_info.sh.

Change-Id: I8757602047696e40c7412046ca497492760ddad3

commit_message:
Implement basic undercloud sanity checks

Add a new feature (disabled by default) to whether or not check
undercloud sanity by testing OpenStack APIs.

* Create undercloud_sanity_check function, that is a basic sanity check
checking if OpenStack APIs are correctly running. Note: use set -x for
openstack cli commands, so we can see what is running.

* Add UNDERCLOUD_SANITY_CHECK parameter (disabled by default) to whether
  or not activate undercloud sanity checks.

Change-Id: I1ff2cc9c1287416405e20fb09e8662acf20507e2

commit_message:
cleanup_live_migration_destination_check spacing

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333519/ renamed
check_can_live_migrate_destination_cleanup to
cleanup_live_migration_destination_check, but neglected to adjust
indents accordingly in several places.  (The tox.ini is set up to ignore
the rules that would have caught these, but that doesn't mean we
shouldn't fix them.)

Change-Id: Icc23e0d083bb103234fd44c710022abec9e41f54

commit_message:
Set secure_proxy_ssl_header 'HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO' for nova-api

[mitaka-only] On master I3918f24c0c87cb626a28645b46e3df6360d5f924
makes it so nova uses the oslo middleware for the header parsing.

That isn't available in mitaka, so we can set the
secure_proxy_ssl_header explicitly via hieradata. Note this is
added to mitaka puppet-nova as an option in change:
I22deb886706fe71115a04fb52a7051be4783a5c4

Closes-Bug: 1606863

Change-Id: I9a5284869d3fca9615d7cbb84705a9cddd0df44a

commit_message:
Add support for node.resource_class

This adds support for the node.resource_class field, introduced in
API 1.21. It can be modified on an existing node or passed when
creating a node, or used as a filter when fetching a list of nodes.

Change-Id: Id494a8b735a3532db84d90ba21da173f7e33ed1d
Depends-On: I936f2e7b2f4d26e01354e826e5595ff021c3a55c
Partial-Bug: #1604916

commit_message:
Allow wildcard in index --type argument

Allow a wildcard character * at the end of the --type argument
to searchlight-manage index sync --type arguments. For instance,
OS::Cinder::* will match all resources with doc types starting
OS::Cinder::. The substitution is done very early early in the process
so as to largely leave the code alone.

Patch also adds functional tests for the manage command (both with
and without this functionality).

Change-Id: Ia7f1efc0a08f085ce081a800c385246c81663bc4
Implements: blueprint allow-reindexing-entire-service

commit_message:
Changing zookeeper path while updating conf

Zookeeper path is hardcoded but we recently changed the path to avoid
having to update the path every time zookeeper changed versions. We
forgot to update this path in one place which causes the cluster to fail
to scale. The patch fix that

Change-Id: Idde36e39ac4c2e2e006b4a92d92e77440666c314
Closes-bug: #1607386

subject: Deprecate os-certificates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/index.rst', 'api-ref/source/os-certificates.inc', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate_os_cert-f0aa07bab1a229aa.yaml', 'nova/cmd/cert.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/789edad0e811d866551bec18dc7729541105f59d', 'message': "Deprecate os-certificates

Coming out of the Nova midcycle we decided we really needed to
deprecate the os-certificates API and service. It is not used by any
of the rest of Nova. It's an API that requires a dedicated daemon to
be run. It's making Nova assume the responsibility for generating
secure certificates, even though it's not really managing entropy in
any sane way (which is why nova-cert is a service, so you could stick
these on all your computes so as to not run out of entropy).

Change-Id: I0ffa9200d8b4f52da4751e731aecffe09fd3d4be
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate os-certificates

Coming out of the Nova midcycle we decided we really needed to
deprecate the os-certificates API and service. It is not used by any
of the rest of Nova. It's an API that requires a dedicated daemon to
be run. It's making Nova assume the responsibility for generating
secure certificates, even though it's not really managing entropy in
any sane way (which is why nova-cert is a service, so you could stick
these on all your computes so as to not run out of entropy).

Change-Id: I0ffa9200d8b4f52da4751e731aecffe09fd3d4be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/347430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ability to instantiate object graph

Adds ability to load object sub-graph in a single call.
The graph may either be defined in the serializable
object-model format

?:
  id: ...
  type: ...
  classVersion: ...
  package: ...
 prop1: value
 prop2: value2

 or in the MuranoPL format

 ns:Type:
   prop1: value1
   prop2: value2
 id: ...
 name: ...

During the load IDs of the loaded objects are re-generated so
that explicit specification of IDs is only necessary for specification
of references within the graph and are not retained.

The load is done in the temporary ObjectStore. Loaded objects are
copied to the main ObjectStore then.

3rd overload of the new() function was added to deserialize the model:
new($model, $owner)

Change-Id: I849a5d6c9a28843398a4c4c884a1c3138ac7ede3

commit_message:
Updated ubuntu-db2 to use datastore-package element to copy files

This element
1. provides a common place to copy packages into the image
   for installing them during image building. So now every
   image element doesn't need to provide extra-data and
   install scripts to do the same work
2. provides user ability to specify the location of the package
   as file/directory/url

Change-Id: Ie15079f5eb0b9bed3f343c78357772f7a2d21ea8

release.

subject: Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE url to include the new branch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 20:38:00.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'make_stable_branch.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/13121d0d60fc95c968dbd80d3c5f6a1b3bd580e1', 'message': "Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE url to include the new branch

The danger here is that if the branch doesn't exisit and the review
merges the new branch or $project will be unconstrained and therefore
testing is somewhat voided.

We need to manage that externally to this process

Change-Id: Iae6aefefcd6b7e96d15bd5d373ae439e4fe80daf
"}]
commit_message:
Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE url to include the new branch

The danger here is that if the branch doesn't exisit and the review
merges the new branch or $project will be unconstrained and therefore
testing is somewhat voided.

We need to manage that externally to this process

Change-Id: Iae6aefefcd6b7e96d15bd5d373ae439e4fe80daf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/27/348027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_upper_constraints "$NEW_BRANCH"

deleted_lines: [db_settings] # Used to identify which repository this database is versioned under. # You can use the name of your project. repository_id=revoke # The name of the database table used to track the schema version. # This name shouldn't already be used by your project. # If this is changed once a database is under version control, you'll need to # change the table name in each database too. version_table=migrate_version # When committing a change script, Migrate will attempt to generate the # sql for all supported databases; normally, if one of them fails - probably # because you don't have that database installed - it is ignored and the # commit continues, perhaps ending successfully. # Databases in this list MUST compile successfully during a commit, or the # entire commit will fail. List the databases your application will actually # be using to ensure your updates to that database work properly. # This must be a list; example: ['postgres','sqlite'] required_dbs=[] # When creating new change scripts, Migrate will stamp the new script with # a version number. By default this is latest_version + 1. You can set this # to 'true' to tell Migrate to use the UTC timestamp instead. use_timestamp_numbering=False

subject: libvirt: fix missed test in migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-06 11:45:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_migration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dc393ef161cbd01482d6c17f0214d1c253253fa4', 'message': 'libvirt: fix missed test in migration

The method get_updated_guest_xml has a specific test to ensure all
dependent methods are well called with the well parameters.  This
commit adds an assertion to ensure update_perf_events_xml is well
called when we want to retrieve the domain xml of a guest for
migration.

Change-Id: Ifda45b824fbc819173498be606622e8e663b2626
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix missed test in migration

The method get_updated_guest_xml has a specific test to ensure all
dependent methods are well called with the well parameters.  This
commit adds an assertion to ensure update_perf_events_xml is well
called when we want to retrieve the domain xml of a guest for
migration.

Change-Id: Ifda45b824fbc819173498be606622e8e663b2626
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/338203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(migration, '_update_perf_events_xml') mock_perf_events_xml, mock_tostring): mock_perf_events_xml.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, data)

commit_message:
Change DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION for vertica

Vertica Management console requires additional
debian packages to be installed as well as other
files for the management console to run

DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION is a directory that has
all files that need to be installed on the image

Additional changes are made to some global variables
to make sure the environment can run the
management console.

Co-Authored-By: Saurabh Surana <saurabh.surana@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sharika Pongubala <sharika.pongubala@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Craig Vyvial <cp16net@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1452926

Change-Id: I2863a21d186d9c809fa2fdb0050e4728e100b010
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/86/181186/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [ -d "$DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION" ] || die "Datastore package installer files not found at the directory:" $DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION #[ -f "$DATASTORE_CONSOLE_PKG_LOCATION" ] || die "Datastore management console package installer file not found at:" $DATASTORE_CONSOLE_PKG_LOCATION #dd if=${DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION} of=${TMP_HOOKS_PATH}/vertica.deb #dd if=${DATASTORE_CONSOLE_PKG_LOCATION} of=${TMP_HOOKS_PATH}/vertica-console.deb mkdir $TMP_HOOKS_PATH/vertica ls -1r $DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION/ for f in `ls -1 $DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION` do package_name=$(basename "$f" ".deb") deb_file_name=`echo $package_name | cut -d "_" -f 1` cp $DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION/$f $TMP_HOOKS_PATH/vertica/$deb_file_name.deb done
deleted_lines: [ -f "$DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION" ] || die "Datastore package installer file not found at:" $DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION dd if=${DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION} of=${TMP_HOOKS_PATH}/vertica.deb

subject: WIP/Proposal: Simplify storage deletion on destroy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 19:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/b0ee1455d3298a8a9944b703bc6a4f482763bb57', 'message': 'WIP/Proposal: Simplify storage deletion on destroy

By greatly simplifying the storage disconnection/deletion pieces of the
destroy flow, we cut out a bunch of LOC, and resolve the issues
described by bug 1604980.

Change-Id: Iaf948ccd349052e4301fa8ba1f75c6b9751bc2d2
Closes-Bug: 1604980
'}]
commit_message:
WIP/Proposal: Simplify storage deletion on destroy

By greatly simplifying the storage disconnection/deletion pieces of the
destroy flow, we cut out a bunch of LOC, and resolve the issues
described by bug 1604980.

Change-Id: Iaf948ccd349052e4301fa8ba1f75c6b9751bc2d2
Closes-Bug: 1604980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/14/348014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from pypowervm.tasks import storage as pvm_tstor pvm_tstor.add_lpar_storage_scrub_tasks( [vm.get_vm_id(self.adapter, pvm_inst_uuid)], stg_ftsk, lpars_exist=True)
deleted_lines: # Add the disconnect/deletion of the vOpt to the transaction # manager. if configdrive.required_by(instance): flow.add(tf_stg.DeleteVOpt( self.adapter, self.host_uuid, instance, pvm_inst_uuid, stg_ftsk=stg_ftsk)) # Determine if there are volumes to disconnect. If so, remove each # volume (within the transaction manager) self._add_volume_disconnection_tasks( context, instance, bdms, flow, stg_ftsk, slot_mgr) # Only detach the disk adapters if this is not a boot from volume # since volumes are handled above. This is only for disks. destroy_disk_task = None if not self._is_booted_from_volume(block_device_info): # Detach the disk storage adapters (when the stg_ftsk runs) flow.add(tf_stg.DetachDisk( self.disk_dvr, context, instance, stg_ftsk)) # Delete the storage disks if destroy_disks: destroy_disk_task = tf_stg.DeleteDisk( self.disk_dvr, context, instance) # The disks shouldn't be destroyed until the unmappings are done. if destroy_disk_task: flow.add(destroy_disk_task)

It's possible to run into issues when logging exception objects. The oslo_i18n
module will attempt to deepcopy parameters before loggin them. If the parameter
is an object, it will deepcopy it. This change makes it so that we pass the
exception's message instead of the whole exception object.

Change-Id: Ic8063e89f658dc34ef3b298ab5fc41ec817b9bbc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log exception objects

It's possible to run into issues when logging exception objects. The oslo_i18n
module will attempt to deepcopy parameters before loggin them. If the parameter
is an object, it will deepcopy it. This change makes it so that we pass the
exception's message instead of the whole exception object.

Change-Id: Ic8063e89f658dc34ef3b298ab5fc41ec817b9bbc

commit_message:
Using Cinder snapshot as trove backups API Change

In order to move on with the implementation of Cinder snapshots as Trove
backups we need to define the internal API changes that will take place.
This patch addresses these changes adding the necessary entry points on
the guest agent API and adding some needed configuration options.
Once we agree with the API structure we can move on with the actual code
patches.

Change-Id: I6d9f2bbe9dc6d401b4decda6c11fb09131d6cc33
Partially-implements: bp snapshot-as-backup-strategy

added_lines: AGENT_DB_QUIESCE_TIMEOUT = CONF.agent_db_quiesce_timeout AGENT_FS_QUIESCE_TIMEOUT = CONF.agent_filesystem_quiesce_timeout def quiesce_db(self): LOG.debug("Quiescing the DB on instance %s." % self.id) return self._call("quiesce_db", AGENT_DB_QUIESCE_TIMEOUT, self.version_cap) def unquiesce_db(self): LOG.debug("Unquiescing the DB on instance %s." % self.id) return self._call("unquiesce_db", AGENT_DB_QUIESCE_TIMEOUT, self.version_cap) def quiesce_filesystem(self, device_path, mount_point): LOG.debug("Quiescing the filesystem on instance %s." % self.id) return self._call("unquiesce_filesystem", AGENT_FS_QUIESCE_TIMEOUT, self.version_cap, device_path=device_path, mount_point=mount_point) def unquiesce_filesystem(self, device_path, mount_point): LOG.debug("Unquiescing the filesystem on instance %s." % self.id) return self._call("unquiesce_filesystem", AGENT_FS_QUIESCE_TIMEOUT, self.version_cap, device_path=device_path, mount_point=mount_point)

commit_message:
release keystoneauth 2.10.0

add new features such as:

  - Lazy load oauthlib for plugin loading
  - Add client_credentials grant type support for OIDC auth
  - Add discovery document support for OIDC auth
  - Use requests for SAML2 auth
  - Add new auth plugin for X.509 tokenless auth

Change-Id: I49328c646271a98295874eef01549864b2a206bf

commit_message:
Keep running grenade on trusty for now

Working out Grenades distro transition is tricky. Keep running on Trusty
for now but with rules to switch stable/newton to xenial.

Change-Id: I949850a5e52f5636e014ae9df7df913b910194ca

commit_message:
compute: Skip driver detach calls for non local instances

Only call for a driver detach from a volume if the instance is currently
associated with the local compute host. This avoids potential virt
driver and volume backend issues when attempting to disconnect from
volumes that have never been connected to from the current host.

Closes-Bug: #1583284
Change-Id: I36b8532554d75b24130f456a35acd0be838b62d6

commit_message:
Followup on an angular Images panel switch

There is a lot of work to be done to make new resource-panel pages to
be testable by Selenium. Few highlights that I stumbled upon while
trying to implement a more meaningful test (click a specific image in
an angularized table, go to its description page, check that image
header text is equal to the image name in table):

* Table actions/buttons are not annotated with ids or attributes in a
  machine-friendly way
* Table columns are not annotated as well for automatic extraction by
  Selenium
* Seamless dispatch between legacy and NG versions of the same page is
  absent (due to obfuscate Navigation machinery, see inline FIXME).

Change-Id: I52fb4f42d557dd7729a0b420b1d03e7353179899

commit_message:
Write script to /var/tmp instead of /usr/local/bin

/var/tmp is world writeable which allows this local
task to be run by non-root users

Further, the deployment host never executes the script
so there is no need for it to be in a location which is
in the $PATH

Change-Id: Icf47ca346634885cab521fc054493ce623f17cb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/93/348393/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve docs for v3 endpoints

In preparation to add functional tests for v3 endpoints, this
change proposes to detail the method docs, because the tests
need to be based on them.

Change-Id: I543e5475417ee1f333733f3a159c64223e44f1f2
Partial-Bug: #1330769

added_lines: """Create an endpoint. :param service: the service to which the endpoint belongs. :type service: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.services.Service` :param str url: the URL of the fully qualified service endpoint. :param str interface: the network interface of the endpoint. Can be ``public``, ``admin`` or ``internal``. :param region: the region to which the endpoint belongs. :type region: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.regions.Region` :param bool enabled: whether the endpoint is enabled or not, determining if it appears in the catalog. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: the created endpoint returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` """ """Retrieve an endpoint. :param endpoint: the endpoint to be retrieved from the server. :type endpoint: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` :returns: the specified endpoint returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` """ :param service: the service of the endpoints to be filtered on. :type service: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.services.Service` :param str interface: the network interface of the endpoints to be filtered on. Can be ``public``, ``admin`` or ``internal``. :param bool enabled: filter in endpoints which are enabled or disabled. :param str region_id: filter in endpoints belonging to the region correspodig to the specified ID. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will filter endpoints on. :returns: a list of endpoints. :rtype: list of :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` """Update an endpoint. :param endpoint: the endpoint to be updated on the server. :type endpoint: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` :param service: the new service to which the endpoint belogns. :type service: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.services.Service` :param str url: the new URL of the fully qualified service endpoint. :param str interface: the new network interface of the endpoint. Can be ``public``, ``admin`` or ``internal``. :param region: the new region to which the endpoint belongs. :type region: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.regions.Region` :param bool enabled: determining if the endpoint appears in the catalog by enabling or disabling it. :param kwargs: any other attribute provided will be passed to the server. :returns: the updated endpoint returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` """ """Delete an endpoint. :param endpoint: the endpoint to be deleted on the server. :type endpoint: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.endpoints.Endpoint` :returns: Response object with 204 status. :rtype: :class:`requests.models.Response` """
deleted_lines: If ``**kwargs`` are provided, then filter endpoints with attributes matching ``**kwargs``.

commit_message:
Support name option for volume restore

Volume restore API supports name option to specify volume name
for new volume creation, but CLI doesn't support this option.
This change simply add name option for backup-restore command.

Change-Id: I22ccc303c86b958cb21862f718ef89f57234a027
Partial-Bug: #1539667

commit_message:
Add region functional tests

Adds functional tests for regions.

Change-Id: I809cd9ea320f3fda7348a110bd30fff1c411fcae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/58/339158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from keystoneauth1.exceptions import http from keystoneclient.tests.functional import base from keystoneclient.tests.functional.v3 import client_fixtures as fixtures class RegionsTestCase(base.V3ClientTestCase): def check_region(self, region, region_ref=None): self.assertIsNotNone(region.id) self.assertIn('self', region.links) self.assertIn('/regions/' + region.id, region.links['self']) if region_ref: self.assertEqual(region_ref['enabled'], region.enabled) # There is no guarantee the below attributes are present in region if hasattr(region_ref, 'description'): self.assertEqual(region_ref['description'], region.description) if hasattr(region_ref, 'parent_region'): self.assertEqual(region_ref['parent_region'], region.parent_region) else: # Only check remaining mandatory attribute self.assertIsNotNone(region.enabled) def test_create_region(self): region_ref = {'enabled': True, 'description': uuid.uuid4().hex} region = self.client.regions.create(**region_ref) self.addCleanup(self.client.regions.delete, region) self.check_region(region, region_ref) def test_get_region(self): region = fixtures.Region(self.client) self.useFixture(region) region_ret = self.client.regions.get(region.id) self.check_region(region_ret, region.ref) def test_list_regions(self): region_one = fixtures.Region(self.client) self.useFixture(region_one) region_two = fixtures.Region(self.client, parent_region=region_one.id) self.useFixture(region_two) regions = self.client.regions.list() # All regions are valid for region in regions: self.check_region(region) self.assertIn(region_one.entity, regions) self.assertIn(region_two.entity, regions) def test_update_region(self): parent = fixtures.Region(self.client) self.useFixture(parent) region = fixtures.Region(self.client) self.useFixture(region) new_description = uuid.uuid4().hex new_enabled = False region_ret = self.client.regions.update(region.id, description=new_description, enabled=new_enabled, parent_region=parent.id) self.check_region(region_ret, region.ref) def test_delete_region(self): region = self.client.regions.create() self.client.regions.delete(region.id) self.assertRaises(http.NotFound, self.client.regions.get, region.id)

commit_message:
Use protocol definitions from neutron-lib

This removes the deprecation warnings for example:

  "DeprecationWarning: PROTO_NAME_TCP in version 'mitaka' and
   will be removed in version 'newton': moved to neutron_lib.constants"

Closes-Bug: #1589107
Change-Id: Ifc800e60ebff083c8e2c82ddf98ac0965b66004e

commit_message:
Make the number of tempest workers configurable

We recently added more vCPUs to the undercloud to workaround the
slower chassis' in CI having slower but more CPU cores. Unfortunately,
this had the side effect of making tempest use many more workers to
run tests, and our very resource constrained cloud falls over when
there are that many requests coming in concurrently.

This patch makes the number of tempest workers explicit and configurable,
rather than the default tempest behavior of using all available CPUs.

Change-Id: I8bb9ad7db0276c3bc1415707b72b93023b6365e0

Slaves querying designate via the vip does not work. Explicitly listing
the slaves spreads load accross the designate units and fixes the
transfers

commit_message:
LBaaS project spinout

Change-Id: I5303b04ec2ca5acd525d9b5137f012515a8dc1df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/05/310805/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= Kill neutron-lbaas, aka LBaaS project spinout ============================================= The Octavia project has, as part of creating the new LBaaS reference implementaiton, also implemented the LBaaS API as a standard pecan/wsgi openstack endpoint. The Octavia LBaaS API would be identical and compatible with the Neutron LBaaS v2 API, excepting the /lbaas root url token being missing. End users of the existing neutron API endpoint will see no differences for two cycles. This spec describes the process for removing LBaaS as a neutron extension, and making it a standalone project of its own. Problem Description =================== The main goals of this spinout will be simplifying the administration and implementation of both, while providing as seamless an experience as possible to operators and end users. There are several reasons for spinning out the lbaas project: * Having your service stuffed into the guts of a neutron-server, while your code is in a separate repo, has been a fairly brittle proposition. * The active teams for lbaas and neutron have virtually no overlap, so the added overhead of administering both is providing no benefit to neutron, and slowly down lbaas. The reasons against: * There is a certain amount of busywork required to finish getting ready to be a completely separate project, listed in proposed changes below. * There is some value in having all the "networking" APIs under one umbrella, though there is precedent for higher-level services being outside (DNSaaS). Proposed Change =============== * Octavia is an API server, a service VM framework for lbaas, and the reference implementation for LBaaS. Currently only service VM centric drivers are supported, so an interface needs to be added so that direct drivers can be used directly behind the API server. This direct driver interface will accept currently neutron LBaaS v2 drivers directly. * Modify the neutron-lbaas API extension to be a direct proxy pass-through to the octavia api controller. * Notify vendors to verify their drivers work with the Octavia API controller, and to move their third-party CIs. * Remove neutron-lbaas/neutron co-gate. * Create client extension. * Create/verify/move API/install guide/user docs. * Apply for governance change from neutron stadium to the big tent. References ========== <link to v2 driver interfaces for octavia here> <link to neutron proxy review here> <link to wip governance patch here>
